1.verse: Luke Writes About Jesus’ Life - Many have tried to report on the things that happened among us.

2.verse: They have written the same things that we learned from others—the people who saw those things from the beginning and served God by telling people his message.

3.verse: Since I myself have studied everything carefully from the beginning, most excellent Theophilus, it seemed good for me to write it out for you. I arranged it in order,

4.verse: to help you know that what you have been taught is true.

5.verse: Zechariah and Elizabeth - During the time Herod ruled Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah who belonged to Abijah’s group. Zechariah’s wife, Elizabeth, came from the family of Aaron.

6.verse: Zechariah and Elizabeth truly did what God said was good. They did everything the Lord commanded and were without fault in keeping his law.

7.verse: But they had no children, because Elizabeth could not have a baby, and both of them were very old.

8.verse: One day Zechariah was serving as a priest before God, because his group was on duty.

9.verse: According to the custom of the priests, he was chosen by lot to go into the Temple of the Lord and burn incense.

10.verse: There were a great many people outside praying at the time the incense was offered.

11.verse: Then an angel of the Lord appeared to Zechariah, standing on the right side of the incense table.

12.verse: When he saw the angel, Zechariah was startled and frightened.

13.verse: But the angel said to him, “Zechariah, don’t be afraid. God has heard your prayer. Your wife, Elizabeth, will give birth to a son, and you will name him John.

14.verse: He will bring you joy and gladness, and many people will be happy because of his birth.

15.verse: John will be a great man for the Lord. He will never drink wine or beer, and even from birth, he will be filled with the Holy Spirit.

16.verse: He will help many people of Israel return to the Lord their God.

17.verse: He will go before the Lord in spirit and power like Elijah. He will make peace between parents and their children and will bring those who are not obeying God back to the right way of thinking, to make a people ready for the coming of the Lord.”

18.verse: Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I know that what you say is true? I am an old man, and my wife is old, too.”

19.verse: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel. I stand before God, who sent me to talk to you and to tell you this good news.

20.verse: Now, listen! You will not be able to speak until the day these things happen, because you did not believe what I told you. But they will really happen.”

21.verse: Outside, the people were still waiting for Zechariah and were surprised that he was staying so long in the Temple.

22.verse: When Zechariah came outside, he could not speak to them, and they knew he had seen a vision in the Temple. He could only make signs to them and remained unable to speak.

23.verse: When his time of service at the Temple was finished, he went home.

24.verse: Later, Zechariah’s wife, Elizabeth, became pregnant and did not go out of her house for five months. Elizabeth said,

25.verse: “Look what the Lord has done for me! My people were ashamed of me, but now the Lord has taken away that shame.”

26.verse: An Angel Appears to Mary - During Elizabeth’s sixth month of pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee,

27.verse: to a virgin. She was engaged to marry a man named Joseph from the family of David. Her name was Mary.

28.verse: The angel came to her and said, “Greetings! The Lord has blessed you and is with you.”

29.verse: But Mary was very startled by what the angel said and wondered what this greeting might mean.

30.verse: The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary; God has shown you his grace.

31.verse: Listen! You will become pregnant and give birth to a son, and you will name him Jesus.

32.verse: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of King David, his ancestor.

33.verse: He will rule over the people of Jacob forever, and his kingdom will never end.”

34.verse: Mary said to the angel, “How will this happen since I am a virgin?”

35.verse: The angel said to Mary, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will cover you. For this reason the baby will be holy and will be called the Son of God.

36.verse: Now Elizabeth, your relative, is also pregnant with a son though she is very old. Everyone thought she could not have a baby, but she has been pregnant for six months.

37.verse: God can do anything!”

38.verse: Mary said, “I am the servant of the Lord. Let this happen to me as you say!” Then the angel went away.

39.verse: Mary Visits Elizabeth - Mary got up and went quickly to a town in the hills of Judea.

40.verse: She came to Zechariah’s house and greeted Elizabeth.

41.verse: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the unborn baby inside her jumped, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.

42.verse: She cried out in a loud voice, “God has blessed you more than any other woman, and he has blessed the baby to which you will give birth.

43.verse: Why has this good thing happened to me, that the mother of my Lord comes to me?

44.verse: When I heard your voice, the baby inside me jumped with joy.

45.verse: You are blessed because you believed that what the Lord said to you would really happen.”

46.verse: Mary Praises God - Then Mary said, “My soul praises the Lord;

47.verse: my heart rejoices in God my Savior,

48.verse: because he has shown his concern for his humble servant girl. From now on, all people will say that I am blessed,

49.verse: because the Powerful One has done great things for me. His name is holy.

50.verse: God will show his mercy forever and ever to those who worship and serve him.

51.verse: He has done mighty deeds by his power. He has scattered the people who are proud and think great things about themselves.

52.verse: He has brought down rulers from their thrones and raised up the humble.

53.verse: He has filled the hungry with good things and sent the rich away with nothing.

54.verse: He has helped his servant, the people of Israel, remembering to show them mercy

55.verse: as he promised to our ancestors, to Abraham and to his children forever.”

56.verse: Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then returned home.

57.verse: The Birth of John - When it was time for Elizabeth to give birth, she had a boy.

58.verse: Her neighbors and relatives heard how good the Lord was to her, and they rejoiced with her.

59.verse: When the baby was eight days old, they came to circumcise him. They wanted to name him Zechariah because this was his father’s name,

60.verse: but his mother said, “No! He will be named John.”

61.verse: The people said to Elizabeth, “But no one in your family has this name.”

62.verse: Then they made signs to his father to find out what he would like to name him.

63.verse: Zechariah asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John,” and everyone was surprised.

64.verse: Immediately Zechariah could talk again, and he began praising God.

65.verse: All their neighbors became alarmed, and in all the mountains of Judea people continued talking about all these things.

66.verse: The people who heard about them wondered, saying, “What will this child be?” because the Lord was with him.

67.verse: Zechariah Praises God - Then Zechariah, John’s father, was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:

68.verse: “Let us praise the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come to help his people and has given them freedom.

69.verse: He has given us a powerful Savior from the family of God’s servant David.

70.verse: He said that he would do this through his holy prophets who lived long ago:

71.verse: He promised he would save us from our enemies and from the power of all those who hate us.

72.verse: He said he would give mercy to our ancestors and that he would remember his holy promise.

74.verse: that he would save us from the power of our enemies so we could serve him without fear,

75.verse: being holy and good before God as long as we live.

76.verse: “Now you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High God. You will go before the Lord to prepare his way.

77.verse: You will make his people know that they will be saved by having their sins forgiven.

78.verse: With the loving mercy of our God, a new day from heaven will dawn upon us.

79.verse: It will shine on those who live in darkness, in the shadow of death. It will guide us into the path of peace.”

80.verse: And so the child grew up and became strong in spirit. John lived in the desert until the time when he came out to preach to Israel.

1.verse: The Birth of Jesus - At that time, Augustus Caesar sent an order that all people in the countries under Roman rule must list their names in a register.

2.verse: This was the first registration; it was taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.

3.verse: And all went to their own towns to be registered.

4.verse: So Joseph left Nazareth, a town in Galilee, and went to the town of Bethlehem in Judea, known as the town of David. Joseph went there because he was from the family of David.

5.verse: Joseph registered with Mary, to whom he was engaged and who was now pregnant.

6.verse: While they were in Bethlehem, the time came for Mary to have the baby,

7.verse: and she gave birth to her first son. Because there were no rooms left in the inn, she wrapped the baby with pieces of cloth and laid him in a feeding trough.

8.verse: Shepherds Hear About Jesus - That night, some shepherds were in the fields nearby watching their sheep.

9.verse: Then an angel of the Lord stood before them. The glory of the Lord was shining around them, and they became very frightened.

10.verse: The angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. I am bringing you good news that will be a great joy to all the people.

11.verse: Today your Savior was born in the town of David. He is Christ, the Lord.

12.verse: This is how you will know him: You will find a baby wrapped in pieces of cloth and lying in a feeding box.”

13.verse: Then a very large group of angels from heaven joined the first angel, praising God and saying:

14.verse: “Give glory to God in heaven, and on earth let there be peace among the people who please God.”

15.verse: When the angels left them and went back to heaven, the shepherds said to each other, “Let’s go to Bethlehem. Let’s see this thing that has happened which the Lord has told us about.”

16.verse: So the shepherds went quickly and found Mary and Joseph and the baby, who was lying in a feeding trough.

17.verse: When they had seen him, they told what the angels had said about this child.

18.verse: Everyone was amazed at what the shepherds said to them.

19.verse: But Mary treasured these things and continued to think about them.

20.verse: Then the shepherds went back to their sheep, praising God and thanking him for everything they had seen and heard. It had been just as the angel had told them.

21.verse: When the baby was eight days old, he was circumcised and was named Jesus, the name given by the angel before the baby began to grow inside Mary.

22.verse: Jesus Is Presented in the Temple - When the time came for Mary and Joseph to do what the law of Moses taught about being made pure, they took Jesus to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord.

23.verse: (It is written in the law of the Lord: “Every firstborn male shall be given to the Lord.”)

24.verse: Mary and Joseph also went to offer a sacrifice, as the law of the Lord says: “You must sacrifice two doves or two young pigeons.”

25.verse: Simeon Sees Jesus - In Jerusalem lived a man named Simeon who was a good man and godly. He was waiting for the time when God would take away Israel’s sorrow, and the Holy Spirit was in him.

26.verse: Simeon had been told by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he saw the Christ promised by the Lord.

27.verse: The Spirit led Simeon to the Temple. When Mary and Joseph brought the baby Jesus to the Temple to do what the law said they must do,

28.verse: Simeon took the baby in his arms and thanked God:

29.verse: “Now, Lord, you can let me, your servant, die in peace as you said.

30.verse: With my own eyes I have seen your salvation,

31.verse: which you prepared before all people.

32.verse: It is a light for the non-Jewish people to see and an honor for your people, the Israelites.”

33.verse: Jesus’ father and mother were amazed at what Simeon had said about him.

34.verse: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, “God has chosen this child to cause the fall and rise of many in Israel. He will be a sign from God that many people will not accept

35.verse: so that the thoughts of many will be made known. And the things that will happen will make your heart sad, too.”

36.verse: Anna Sees Jesus - There was a prophetess, Anna, from the family of Phanuel in the tribe of Asher. Anna was very old. She had once been married for seven years.

37.verse: Then her husband died, and she was a widow for eighty-four years. Anna never left the Temple but worshiped God, going without food and praying day and night.

38.verse: Standing there at that time, she thanked God and spoke about Jesus to all who were waiting for God to free Jerusalem.

39.verse: Joseph and Mary Return Home - When Joseph and Mary had done everything the law of the Lord commanded, they went home to Nazareth, their own town in Galilee.

40.verse: The little child grew and became strong. He was filled with wisdom, and God’s goodness was upon him.

41.verse: Jesus As a Boy - Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Passover Feast.

42.verse: When he was twelve years old, they went to the feast as they always did.

43.verse: After the feast days were over, they started home. The boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but his parents did not know it.

44.verse: Thinking that Jesus was with them in the group, they traveled for a whole day. Then they began to look for him among their family and friends.

45.verse: When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him there.

46.verse: After three days they found Jesus sitting in the Temple with the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.

47.verse: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and answers.

48.verse: When Jesus’ parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, “Son, why did you do this to us? Your father and I were very worried about you and have been looking for you.”

49.verse: Jesus said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”

50.verse: But they did not understand the meaning of what he said.

51.verse: Jesus went with them to Nazareth and was obedient to them. But his mother kept in her mind all that had happened.

52.verse: Jesus became wiser and grew physically. People liked him, and he pleased God.

1.verse: The Preaching of John - It was the fifteenth year of the rule of Tiberius Caesar. These men were under Caesar: Pontius Pilate, the ruler of Judea; Herod, the ruler of Galilee; Philip, Herod’s brother, the ruler of Iturea and Traconitis; and Lysanias, the ruler of Abilene.

2.verse: Annas and Caiaphas were the high priests. At this time, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the desert.

3.verse: He went all over the area around the Jordan River preaching a baptism of changed hearts and lives for the forgiveness of sins.

4.verse: As it is written in the book of Isaiah the prophet: “This is a voice of one who calls out in the desert: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord. Make the road straight for him.

5.verse: Every valley should be filled in, and every mountain and hill should be made flat. Roads with turns should be made straight, and rough roads should be made smooth.

6.verse: And all people will know about the salvation of God!’” Isaiah 40:3–5

7.verse: To the crowds of people who came to be baptized by John, he said, “You are all snakes! Who warned you to run away from God’s coming punishment?

8.verse: Do the things that show you really have changed your hearts and lives. Don’t begin to say to yourselves, ‘Abraham is our father.’ I tell you that God could make children for Abraham from these rocks.

9.verse: The ax is now ready to cut down the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”

10.verse: The people asked John, “Then what should we do?”

11.verse: John answered, “If you have two shirts, share with the person who does not have one. If you have food, share that also.”

12.verse: Even tax collectors came to John to be baptized. They said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”

13.verse: John said to them, “Don’t take more taxes from people than you have been ordered to take.”

14.verse: The soldiers asked John, “What about us? What should we do?” John said to them, “Don’t force people to give you money, and don’t lie about them. Be satisfied with the pay you get.”

15.verse: Since the people were hoping for the Christ to come, they wondered if John might be the one.

16.verse: John answered everyone, “I baptize you with water, but there is one coming who is greater than I am. I am not good enough to untie his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.

17.verse: He will come ready to clean the grain, separating the good grain from the chaff. He will put the good part of the grain into his barn, but he will burn the chaff with a fire that cannot be put out.”

18.verse: And John continued to preach the Good News, saying many other things to encourage the people.

19.verse: But John spoke against Herod, the governor, because of his sin with Herodias, the wife of Herod’s brother, and because of the many other evil things Herod did.

20.verse: So Herod did something even worse: He put John in prison.

21.verse: Jesus Is Baptized by John - When all the people were being baptized by John, Jesus also was baptized. While Jesus was praying, heaven opened

22.verse: and the Holy Spirit came down on him in the form of a dove. Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “You are my Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with you.”

23.verse: The Family History of Jesus - When Jesus began his ministry, he was about thirty years old. People thought that Jesus was Joseph’s son. Joseph was the son of Heli.

24.verse: Heli was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi. Levi was the son of Melki. Melki was the son of Jannai. Jannai was the son of Joseph.

25.verse: Joseph was the son of Mattathias. Mattathias was the son of Amos. Amos was the son of Nahum. Nahum was the son of Esli. Esli was the son of Naggai.

26.verse: Naggai was the son of Maath. Maath was the son of Mattathias. Mattathias was the son of Semein. Semein was the son of Josech. Josech was the son of Joda.

27.verse: Joda was the son of Joanan. Joanan was the son of Rhesa. Rhesa was the son of Zerubbabel. Zerubbabel was the grandson of Shealtiel. Shealtiel was the son of Neri.

28.verse: Neri was the son of Melki. Melki was the son of Addi. Addi was the son of Cosam. Cosam was the son of Elmadam. Elmadam was the son of Er.

29.verse: Er was the son of Joshua. Joshua was the son of Eliezer. Eliezer was the son of Jorim. Jorim was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi.

30.verse: Levi was the son of Simeon. Simeon was the son of Judah. Judah was the son of Joseph. Joseph was the son of Jonam. Jonam was the son of Eliakim.

31.verse: Eliakim was the son of Melea. Melea was the son of Menna. Menna was the son of Mattatha. Mattatha was the son of Nathan. Nathan was the son of David.

32.verse: David was the son of Jesse. Jesse was the son of Obed. Obed was the son of Boaz. Boaz was the son of Salmon. Salmon was the son of Nahshon.

33.verse: Nahshon was the son of Amminadab. Amminadab was the son of Admin. Admin was the son of Arni. Arni was the son of Hezron. Hezron was the son of Perez. Perez was the son of Judah.

34.verse: Judah was the son of Jacob. Jacob was the son of Isaac. Isaac was the son of Abraham. Abraham was the son of Terah. Terah was the son of Nahor.

35.verse: Nahor was the son of Serug. Serug was the son of Reu. Reu was the son of Peleg. Peleg was the son of Eber. Eber was the son of Shelah.

36.verse: Shelah was the son of Cainan. Cainan was the son of Arphaxad. Arphaxad was the son of Shem. Shem was the son of Noah. Noah was the son of Lamech.

37.verse: Lamech was the son of Methuselah. Methuselah was the son of Enoch. Enoch was the son of Jared. Jared was the son of Mahalalel. Mahalalel was the son of Kenan.

38.verse: Kenan was the son of Enosh. Enosh was the son of Seth. Seth was the son of Adam. Adam was the son of God.

1.verse: Jesus Is Tempted by the Devil - Jesus, filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River. The Spirit led Jesus into the desert

2.verse: where the devil tempted Jesus for forty days. Jesus ate nothing during that time, and when those days were ended, he was very hungry.

3.verse: The devil said to Jesus, “If you are the Son of God, tell this rock to become bread.”

4.verse: Jesus answered, “It is written in the Scriptures: ‘A person does not live on bread alone.’”

5.verse: Then the devil took Jesus and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in an instant.

6.verse: The devil said to Jesus, “I will give you all these kingdoms and all their power and glory. It has all been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I wish.

7.verse: If you worship me, then it will all be yours.”

8.verse: Jesus answered, “It is written in the Scriptures: ‘You must worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”

9.verse: Then the devil led Jesus to Jerusalem and put him on a high place of the Temple. He said to Jesus, “If you are the Son of God, jump down.

10.verse: It is written in the Scriptures: ‘He has put his angels in charge of you to watch over you.’ Psalm 91:11

11.verse: It is also written: ‘They will catch you in their hands so that you will not hit your foot on a rock.’” Psalm 91:12

12.verse: Jesus answered, “But it also says in the Scriptures: ‘Do not test the Lord your God.’”

13.verse: After the devil had tempted Jesus in every way, he left him to wait until a better time.

14.verse: Jesus Teaches the People - Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Holy Spirit, and stories about him spread all through the area.

15.verse: He began to teach in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.

16.verse: Jesus traveled to Nazareth, where he had grown up. On the Sabbath day he went to the synagogue, as he always did, and stood up to read.

17.verse: The book of Isaiah the prophet was given to him. He opened the book and found the place where this is written:

18.verse: “The Lord has put his Spirit in me, because he appointed me to tell the Good News to the poor. He has sent me to tell the captives they are free and to tell the blind that they can see again. Isaiah 61:1 God sent me to free those who have been treated unfairly Isaiah 58:6

19.verse: and to announce the time when the Lord will show his kindness.” Isaiah 61:2

20.verse: Jesus closed the book, gave it back to the assistant, and sat down. Everyone in the synagogue was watching Jesus closely.

21.verse: He began to say to them, “While you heard these words just now, they were coming true!”

22.verse: All the people spoke well of Jesus and were amazed at the words of grace he spoke. They asked, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”

23.verse: Jesus said to them, “I know that you will tell me the old saying: ‘Doctor, heal yourself.’ You want to say, ‘We heard about the things you did in Capernaum. Do those things here in your own town!’”

24.verse: Then Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, a prophet is not accepted in his hometown.

25.verse: But I tell you the truth, there were many widows in Israel during the time of Elijah. It did not rain in Israel for three and one-half years, and there was no food anywhere in the whole country.

26.verse: But Elijah was sent to none of those widows, only to a widow in Zarephath, a town in Sidon.

27.verse: And there were many with skin diseases living in Israel during the time of the prophet Elisha. But none of them were healed, only Naaman, who was from the country of Syria.”

28.verse: When all the people in the synagogue heard these things, they became very angry.

29.verse: They got up, forced Jesus out of town, and took him to the edge of the cliff on which the town was built. They planned to throw him off the edge,

30.verse: but Jesus walked through the crowd and went on his way.

31.verse: Jesus Forces Out an Evil Spirit - Jesus went to Capernaum, a city in Galilee, and on the Sabbath day, he taught the people.

32.verse: They were amazed at his teaching, because he spoke with authority.

33.verse: In the synagogue a man who had within him an evil spirit shouted in a loud voice,

34.verse: “Jesus of Nazareth! What do you want with us? Did you come to destroy us? I know who you are—God’s Holy One!”

35.verse: Jesus commanded the evil spirit, “Be quiet! Come out of the man!” The evil spirit threw the man down to the ground before all the people and then left the man without hurting him.

36.verse: The people were amazed and said to each other, “What does this mean? With authority and power he commands evil spirits, and they come out.”

37.verse: And so the news about Jesus spread to every place in the whole area.

38.verse: Jesus Heals Many People - Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. Simon’s mother-in-law was sick with a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.

39.verse: He came to her side and commanded the fever to leave. It left her, and immediately she got up and began serving them.

40.verse: When the sun went down, the people brought those who were sick to Jesus. Putting his hands on each sick person, he healed every one of them.

41.verse: Demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God.” But Jesus commanded the demons and would not allow them to speak, because they knew Jesus was the Christ.

42.verse: At daybreak, Jesus went to a lonely place, but the people looked for him. When they found him, they tried to keep him from leaving.

43.verse: But Jesus said to them, “I must preach about God’s kingdom to other towns, too. This is why I was sent.”

44.verse: Then he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.

1.verse: Jesus’ First Followers - One day while Jesus was standing beside Lake Galilee, many people were pressing all around him to hear the word of God.

2.verse: Jesus saw two boats at the shore of the lake. The fishermen had left them and were washing their nets.

3.verse: Jesus got into one of the boats, the one that belonged to Simon, and asked him to push off a little from the land. Then Jesus sat down and continued to teach the people from the boat.

4.verse: When Jesus had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Take the boat into deep water, and put your nets in the water to catch some fish.”

5.verse: Simon answered, “Master, we worked hard all night trying to catch fish, and we caught nothing. But you say to put the nets in the water, so I will.”

6.verse: When the fishermen did as Jesus told them, they caught so many fish that the nets began to break.

7.verse: They called to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. They came and filled both boats so full that they were almost sinking.

8.verse: When Simon Peter saw what had happened, he bowed down before Jesus and said, “Go away from me, Lord. I am a sinful man!”

9.verse: He and the other fishermen were amazed at the many fish they caught, as were

10.verse: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon’s partners. Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will fish for people.”

11.verse: When the men brought their boats to the shore, they left everything and followed Jesus.

12.verse: Jesus Heals a Sick Man - When Jesus was in one of the towns, there was a man covered with a skin disease. When he saw Jesus, he bowed before him and begged him, “Lord, you can heal me if you will.”

13.verse: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man and said, “I will. Be healed!” Immediately the disease disappeared.

14.verse: Then Jesus said, “Don’t tell anyone about this, but go and show yourself to the priest and offer a gift for your healing, as Moses commanded. This will show the people what I have done.”

15.verse: But the news about Jesus spread even more. Many people came to hear Jesus and to be healed of their sicknesses,

16.verse: but Jesus often slipped away to be alone so he could pray.

17.verse: Jesus Heals a Paralyzed Man - One day as Jesus was teaching the people, the Pharisees and teachers of the law from every town in Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem were there. The Lord was giving Jesus the power to heal people.

18.verse: Just then, some men were carrying on a mat a man who was paralyzed. They tried to bring him in and put him down before Jesus.

19.verse: But because there were so many people there, they could not find a way in. So they went up on the roof and lowered the man on his mat through the ceiling into the middle of the crowd right before Jesus.

20.verse: Seeing their faith, Jesus said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”

21.verse: The Jewish teachers of the law and the Pharisees thought to themselves, “Who is this man who is speaking as if he were God? Only God can forgive sins.”

22.verse: But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, “Why are you thinking these things?

23.verse: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?

24.verse: But I will prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So Jesus said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, stand up, take your mat, and go home.”

25.verse: At once the man stood up before them, picked up his mat, and went home, praising God.

26.verse: All the people were fully amazed and began to praise God. They were filled with much respect and said, “Today we have seen amazing things!”

27.verse: Levi Follows Jesus - After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting in the tax collector’s booth. Jesus said to him, “Follow me!”

28.verse: So Levi got up, left everything, and followed him.

29.verse: Then Levi gave a big dinner for Jesus at his house. Many tax collectors and other people were eating there, too.

30.verse: But the Pharisees and the men who taught the law for the Pharisees began to complain to Jesus’ followers, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”

31.verse: Jesus answered them, “It is not the healthy people who need a doctor, but the sick.

32.verse: I have not come to invite good people but sinners to change their hearts and lives.”

33.verse: Jesus Answers a Question - They said to Jesus, “John’s followers often fast for a certain time and pray, just as the Pharisees do. But your followers eat and drink all the time.”

34.verse: Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the friends of the bridegroom fast while he is still with them.

35.verse: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.”

36.verse: Jesus told them this story: “No one takes cloth off a new coat to cover a hole in an old coat. Otherwise, he ruins the new coat, and the cloth from the new coat will not be the same as the old cloth.

37.verse: Also, no one ever pours new wine into old leather bags. Otherwise, the new wine will break the bags, the wine will spill out, and the leather bags will be ruined.

38.verse: New wine must be put into new leather bags.

39.verse: No one after drinking old wine wants new wine, because he says, ‘The old wine is better.’”

1.verse: Jesus Is Lord over the Sabbath - One Sabbath day Jesus was walking through some fields of grain. His followers picked the heads of grain, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.

2.verse: Some Pharisees said, “Why do you do what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “Have you not read what David did when he and those with him were hungry?

4.verse: He went into God’s house and took and ate the holy bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he gave some to the people who were with him.”

5.verse: Then Jesus said to the Pharisees, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath day.”

6.verse: Jesus Heals a Man’s Hand - On another Sabbath day Jesus went into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man with a crippled right hand was there.

7.verse: The teachers of the law and the Pharisees were watching closely to see if Jesus would heal on the Sabbath day so they could accuse him.

8.verse: But he knew what they were thinking, and he said to the man with the crippled hand, “Stand up here in the middle of everyone.” The man got up and stood there.

9.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath day: to do good or to do evil, to save a life or to destroy it?”

10.verse: Jesus looked around at all of them and said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand, and it was healed.

11.verse: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law were very angry and discussed with each other what they could do to Jesus.

12.verse: Jesus Chooses His Apostles - At that time Jesus went off to a mountain to pray, and he spent the night praying to God.

13.verse: The next morning, Jesus called his followers to him and chose twelve of them, whom he named apostles:

14.verse: Simon (Jesus named him Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,

15.verse: Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon (called the Zealot),

16.verse: Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who later turned Jesus over to his enemies.

17.verse: Jesus Teaches and Heals - Jesus and the apostles came down from the mountain, and he stood on level ground. A large group of his followers was there, as well as many people from all around Judea, Jerusalem, and the seacoast cities of Tyre and Sidon.

18.verse: They all came to hear Jesus teach and to be healed of their sicknesses, and he healed those who were troubled by evil spirits.

19.verse: All the people were trying to touch Jesus, because power was coming from him and healing them all.

20.verse: Jesus looked at his followers and said, “You people who are poor are blessed, because the kingdom of God belongs to you.

21.verse: You people who are now hungry are blessed, because you will be satisfied. You people who are now crying are blessed, because you will laugh with joy.

22.verse: “People will hate you, shut you out, insult you, and say you are evil because you follow the Son of Man. But when they do, you will be blessed.

23.verse: Be full of joy at that time, because you have a great reward in heaven. Their ancestors did the same things to the prophets.

24.verse: “But how terrible it will be for you who are rich, because you have had your easy life.

25.verse: How terrible it will be for you who are full now, because you will be hungry. How terrible it will be for you who are laughing now, because you will be sad and cry.

26.verse: “How terrible when everyone says only good things about you, because their ancestors said the same things about the false prophets.

27.verse: Love Your Enemies - “But I say to you who are listening, love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you,

28.verse: bless those who curse you, pray for those who are cruel to you.

29.verse: If anyone slaps you on one cheek, offer him the other cheek, too. If someone takes your coat, do not stop him from taking your shirt.

30.verse: Give to everyone who asks you, and when someone takes something that is yours, don’t ask for it back.

31.verse: Do to others what you would want them to do to you.

32.verse: If you love only the people who love you, what praise should you get? Even sinners love the people who love them.

33.verse: If you do good only to those who do good to you, what praise should you get? Even sinners do that!

34.verse: If you lend things to people, always hoping to get something back, what praise should you get? Even sinners lend to other sinners so that they can get back the same amount!

35.verse: But love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them without hoping to get anything back. Then you will have a great reward, and you will be children of the Most High God, because he is kind even to people who are ungrateful and full of sin.

36.verse: Show mercy, just as your Father shows mercy.

37.verse: Look at Yourselves - “Don’t judge others, and you will not be judged. Don’t accuse others of being guilty, and you will not be accused of being guilty. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

38.verse: Give, and you will receive. You will be given much. Pressed down, shaken together, and running over, it will spill into your lap. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you.”

39.verse: Jesus told them this story: “Can a blind person lead another blind person? No! Both of them will fall into a ditch.

40.verse: A student is not better than the teacher, but the student who has been fully trained will be like the teacher.

41.verse: “Why do you notice the little piece of dust in your friend’s eye, but you don’t notice the big piece of wood in your own eye?

42.verse: How can you say to your friend, ‘Friend, let me take that little piece of dust out of your eye’ when you cannot see that big piece of wood in your own eye! You hypocrite! First, take the wood out of your own eye. Then you will see clearly to take the dust out of your friend’s eye.

43.verse: Two Kinds of Fruit - “A good tree does not produce bad fruit, nor does a bad tree produce good fruit.

44.verse: Each tree is known by its own fruit. People don’t gather figs from thornbushes, and they don’t get grapes from bushes.

45.verse: Good people bring good things out of the good they stored in their hearts. But evil people bring evil things out of the evil they stored in their hearts. People speak the things that are in their hearts.

46.verse: Two Kinds of People - “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ but do not do what I say?

47.verse: I will show you what everyone is like who comes to me and hears my words and obeys.

48.verse: That person is like a man building a house who dug deep and laid the foundation on rock. When the floods came, the water tried to wash the house away, but it could not shake it, because the house was built well.

49.verse: But the one who hears my words and does not obey is like a man who built his house on the ground without a foundation. When the floods came, the house quickly fell and was completely destroyed.”

1.verse: Jesus Heals a Soldier’s Servant - When Jesus finished saying all these things to the people, he went to Capernaum.

2.verse: There was an army officer who had a servant who was very important to him. The servant was so sick he was nearly dead.

3.verse: When the officer heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him to ask Jesus to come and heal his servant.

4.verse: The men went to Jesus and begged him, saying, “This officer is worthy of your help.

5.verse: He loves our people, and he built us a synagogue.”

6.verse: So Jesus went with the men. He was getting near the officer’s house when the officer sent friends to say, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, because I am not worthy to have you come into my house.

7.verse: That is why I did not come to you myself. But you only need to command it, and my servant will be healed.

8.verse: I, too, am a man under the authority of others, and I have soldiers under my command. I tell one soldier, ‘Go,’ and he goes. I tell another soldier, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and my servant does it.”

9.verse: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. Turning to the crowd that was following him, he said, “I tell you, this is the greatest faith I have found anywhere, even in Israel.”

10.verse: Those who had been sent to Jesus went back to the house where they found the servant in good health.

11.verse: Jesus Brings a Man Back to Life - Soon afterwards Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his followers and a large crowd traveled with him.

12.verse: When he came near the town gate, he saw a funeral. A mother, who was a widow, had lost her only son. A large crowd from the town was with the mother while her son was being carried out.

13.verse: When the Lord saw her, he felt very sorry for her and said, “Don’t cry.”

14.verse: He went up and touched the coffin, and the people who were carrying it stopped. Jesus said, “Young man, I tell you, get up!”

15.verse: And the son sat up and began to talk. Then Jesus gave him back to his mother.

16.verse: All the people were amazed and began praising God, saying, “A great prophet has come to us! God has come to help his people.”

17.verse: This news about Jesus spread through all Judea and into all the places around there.

18.verse: John Asks a Question - John’s followers told him about all these things. He called for two of his followers

19.verse: and sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?”

20.verse: When the men came to Jesus, they said, “John the Baptist sent us to you with this question: ‘Are you the One who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?’”

21.verse: At that time, Jesus healed many people of their sicknesses, diseases, and evil spirits, and he gave sight to many blind people.

22.verse: Then Jesus answered John’s followers, “Go tell John what you saw and heard here. The blind can see, the crippled can walk, and people with skin diseases are healed. The deaf can hear, the dead are raised to life, and the Good News is preached to the poor.

23.verse: Those who do not stumble in their faith because of me are blessed!”

24.verse: When John’s followers left, Jesus began talking to the people about John: “What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed blown by the wind?

25.verse: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, people who have fine clothes and much wealth live in kings’ palaces.

26.verse: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, and I tell you, John is more than a prophet.

27.verse: This was written about him: ‘I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare the way for you.’ Malachi 3:1

28.verse: I tell you, John is greater than any other person ever born, but even the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than John.”

29.verse: (When the people, including the tax collectors, heard this, they all agreed that God’s teaching was good, because they had been baptized by John.

30.verse: But the Pharisees and experts on the law refused to accept God’s plan for themselves; they did not let John baptize them.)

31.verse: Then Jesus said, “What shall I say about the people of this time? What are they like?

32.verse: They are like children sitting in the marketplace, calling to one another and saying, ‘We played music for you, but you did not dance; we sang a sad song, but you did not cry.’

33.verse: John the Baptist came and did not eat bread or drink wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon in him.’

34.verse: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him! He eats too much and drinks too much wine, and he is a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

35.verse: But wisdom is proved to be right by what it does.”

36.verse: A Woman Washes Jesus’ Feet - One of the Pharisees asked Jesus to eat with him, so Jesus went into the Pharisee’s house and sat at the table.

37.verse: A sinful woman in the town learned that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee’s house. So she brought an alabaster jar of perfume

38.verse: and stood behind Jesus at his feet, crying. She began to wash his feet with her tears, and she dried them with her hair, kissing them many times and rubbing them with the perfume.

39.verse: When the Pharisee who asked Jesus to come to his house saw this, he thought to himself, “If Jesus were a prophet, he would know that the woman touching him is a sinner!”

40.verse: Jesus said to the Pharisee, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” Simon said, “Teacher, tell me.”

41.verse: Jesus said, “Two people owed money to the same banker. One owed five hundred coins and the other owed fifty.

42.verse: They had no money to pay what they owed, but the banker told both of them they did not have to pay him. Which person will love the banker more?”

43.verse: Simon, the Pharisee, answered, “I think it would be the one who owed him the most money.” Jesus said to Simon, “You are right.”

44.verse: Then Jesus turned toward the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? When I came into your house, you gave me no water for my feet, but she washed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.

45.verse: You gave me no kiss of greeting, but she has been kissing my feet since I came in.

46.verse: You did not put oil on my head, but she poured perfume on my feet.

47.verse: I tell you that her many sins are forgiven, so she showed great love. But the person who is forgiven only a little will love only a little.”

48.verse: Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”

49.verse: The people sitting at the table began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

50.verse: Jesus said to the woman, “Because you believed, you are saved from your sins. Go in peace.”

1.verse: The Group with Jesus - After this, while Jesus was traveling through some cities and small towns, he preached and told the Good News about God’s kingdom. The twelve apostles were with him,

2.verse: and also some women who had been healed of sicknesses and evil spirits: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

3.verse: Joanna, the wife of Cuza (the manager of Herod’s house); Susanna; and many others. These women used their own money to help Jesus and his apostles.

4.verse: A Story About Planting Seed - When a great crowd was gathered, and people were coming to Jesus from every town, he told them this story:

5.verse: “A farmer went out to plant his seed. While he was planting, some seed fell by the road. People walked on the seed, and the birds ate it up.

6.verse: Some seed fell on rock, and when it began to grow, it died because it had no water.

7.verse: Some seed fell among thorny weeds, but the weeds grew up with it and choked the good plants.

8.verse: And some seed fell on good ground and grew and made a hundred times more.” As Jesus finished the story, he called out, “Let those with ears use them and listen!”

9.verse: Jesus’ followers asked him what this story meant.

10.verse: Jesus said, “You have been chosen to know the secrets about the kingdom of God. But I use stories to speak to other people so that: ‘They will look, but they may not see. They will listen, but they may not understand.’ Isaiah 6:9

11.verse: “This is what the story means: The seed is God’s message.

12.verse: The seed that fell beside the road is like the people who hear God’s teaching, but the devil comes and takes it away from them so they cannot believe it and be saved.

13.verse: The seed that fell on rock is like those who hear God’s teaching and accept it gladly, but they don’t allow the teaching to go deep into their lives. They believe for a while, but when trouble comes, they give up.

14.verse: The seed that fell among the thorny weeds is like those who hear God’s teaching, but they let the worries, riches, and pleasures of this life keep them from growing and producing good fruit.

15.verse: And the seed that fell on the good ground is like those who hear God’s teaching with good, honest hearts and obey it and patiently produce good fruit.

16.verse: Use What You Have - “No one after lighting a lamp covers it with a bowl or hides it under a bed. Instead, the person puts it on a lampstand so those who come in will see the light.

17.verse: Everything that is hidden will become clear, and every secret thing will be made known.

18.verse: So be careful how you listen. Those who have understanding will be given more. But those who do not have understanding, even what they think they have will be taken away from them.”

19.verse: Jesus’ True Family - Jesus’ mother and brothers came to see him, but there was such a crowd they could not get to him.

20.verse: Someone said to Jesus, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”

21.verse: Jesus answered them, “My mother and my brothers are those who listen to God’s teaching and obey it!”

22.verse: Jesus Calms a Storm - One day Jesus and his followers got into a boat, and he said to them, “Let’s go across the lake.” And so they started across.

23.verse: While they were sailing, Jesus fell asleep. A very strong wind blew up on the lake, causing the boat to fill with water, and they were in danger.

24.verse: The followers went to Jesus and woke him, saying, “Master! Master! We will drown!” Jesus got up and gave a command to the wind and the waves. They stopped, and it became calm.

25.verse: Jesus said to his followers, “Where is your faith?” The followers were afraid and amazed and said to each other, “Who is this that commands even the wind and the water, and they obey him?”

26.verse: A Man with Demons Inside Him - Jesus and his followers sailed across the lake from Galilee to the area of the Gerasene people.

27.verse: When Jesus got out on the land, a man from the town who had demons inside him came to Jesus. For a long time he had worn no clothes and had lived in the burial caves, not in a house.

28.verse: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before him. He said with a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torture me!”

29.verse: He said this because Jesus was commanding the evil spirit to come out of the man. Many times it had taken hold of him. Though he had been kept under guard and chained hand and foot, he had broken his chains and had been forced by the demon out into a lonely place.

30.verse: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “Legion,” because many demons were in him.

31.verse: The demons begged Jesus not to send them into eternal darkness.

32.verse: A large herd of pigs was feeding on a hill, and the demons begged Jesus to allow them to go into the pigs. So Jesus allowed them to do this.

33.verse: When the demons came out of the man, they went into the pigs, and the herd ran down the hill into the lake and was drowned.

34.verse: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they ran away and told about this in the town and the countryside.

35.verse: And people went to see what had happened. When they came to Jesus, they found the man sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind, because the demons were gone. But the people were frightened.

36.verse: The people who saw this happen told the others how Jesus had made the man well.

37.verse: All the people of the Gerasene country asked Jesus to leave, because they were all very afraid. So Jesus got into the boat and went back to Galilee.

38.verse: The man whom Jesus had healed begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

39.verse: “Go back home and tell people how much God has done for you.” So the man went all over town telling how much Jesus had done for him.

40.verse: Jesus Gives Life to a Dead Girl and Heals a Sick Woman - When Jesus got back to Galilee, a crowd welcomed him, because everyone was waiting for him.

41.verse: A man named Jairus, a leader of the synagogue, came to Jesus and fell at his feet, begging him to come to his house.

42.verse: Jairus’ only daughter, about twelve years old, was dying. While Jesus was on his way to Jairus’ house, the people were crowding all around him.

43.verse: A woman was in the crowd who had been bleeding for twelve years, but no one was able to heal her.

44.verse: She came up behind Jesus and touched the edge of his coat, and instantly her bleeding stopped.

45.verse: Then Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all the people said they had not touched him, Peter said, “Master, the people are all around you and are pushing against you.”

46.verse: But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, because I felt power go out from me.”

47.verse: When the woman saw she could not hide, she came forward, shaking, and fell down before Jesus. While all the people listened, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed.

48.verse: Jesus said to her, “Dear woman, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace.”

49.verse: While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue leader and said to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”

50.verse: When Jesus heard this, he said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid. Just believe, and your daughter will be well.”

51.verse: When Jesus went to the house, he let only Peter, John, James, and the girl’s father and mother go inside with him.

52.verse: All the people were crying and feeling sad because the girl was dead, but Jesus said, “Stop crying. She is not dead, only asleep.”

53.verse: The people laughed at Jesus because they knew the girl was dead.

54.verse: But Jesus took hold of her hand and called to her, “My child, stand up!”

55.verse: Her spirit came back into her, and she stood up at once. Then Jesus ordered that she be given something to eat.

56.verse: The girl’s parents were amazed, but Jesus told them not to tell anyone what had happened.

1.verse: Jesus Sends Out the Apostles - Jesus called the twelve apostles together and gave them power and authority over all demons and the ability to heal sicknesses.

2.verse: He sent the apostles out to tell about God’s kingdom and to heal the sick.

3.verse: He said to them, “Take nothing for your trip, neither a walking stick, bag, bread, money, or extra clothes.

4.verse: When you enter a house, stay there until it is time to leave.

5.verse: If people do not welcome you, shake the dust off of your feet as you leave the town, as a warning to them.”

6.verse: So the apostles went out and traveled through all the towns, preaching the Good News and healing people everywhere.

7.verse: Herod Is Confused About Jesus - Herod, the governor, heard about all the things that were happening and was confused, because some people said, “John the Baptist has risen from the dead.”

8.verse: Others said, “Elijah has come to us.” And still others said, “One of the prophets who lived long ago has risen from the dead.”

9.verse: Herod said, “I cut off John’s head, so who is this man I hear such things about?” And Herod kept trying to see Jesus.

10.verse: More than Five Thousand Fed - When the apostles returned, they told Jesus everything they had done. Then Jesus took them with him to a town called Bethsaida where they could be alone together.

11.verse: But the people learned where Jesus went and followed him. He welcomed them and talked with them about God’s kingdom and healed those who needed to be healed.

12.verse: Late in the afternoon, the twelve apostles came to Jesus and said, “Send the people away. They need to go to the towns and countryside around here and find places to sleep and something to eat, because no one lives in this place.”

13.verse: But Jesus said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish, unless we go buy food for all these people.”

14.verse: (There were about five thousand men there.) Jesus said to his followers, “Tell the people to sit in groups of about fifty people.”

15.verse: So the followers did this, and all the people sat down.

16.verse: Then Jesus took the five loaves of bread and two fish, and looking up to heaven, he thanked God for the food. Then he divided the food and gave it to the followers to give to the people.

17.verse: They all ate and were satisfied, and what was left over was gathered up, filling twelve baskets.

18.verse: Jesus Is the Christ - One time when Jesus was praying alone, his followers were with him, and he asked them, “Who do the people say I am?”

19.verse: They answered, “Some say you are John the Baptist. Others say you are Elijah. And others say you are one of the prophets from long ago who has come back to life.”

20.verse: Then Jesus asked, “But who do you say I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Christ from God.”

21.verse: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone, saying,

22.verse: “The Son of Man must suffer many things. He will be rejected by the Jewish elders, the leading priests, and the teachers of the law. He will be killed and after three days will be raised from the dead.”

23.verse: Jesus said to all of them, “If people want to follow me, they must give up the things they want. They must be willing to give up their lives daily to follow me.

24.verse: Those who want to save their lives will give up true life. But those who give up their lives for me will have true life.

25.verse: It is worthless to have the whole world if they themselves are destroyed or lost.

26.verse: If people are ashamed of me and my teaching, then the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his glory and with the glory of the Father and the holy angels.

27.verse: I tell you the truth, some people standing here will see the kingdom of God before they die.”

28.verse: Jesus Talks with Moses and Elijah - About eight days after Jesus said these things, he took Peter, John, and James and went up on a mountain to pray.

29.verse: While Jesus was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became shining white.

30.verse: Then two men, Moses and Elijah, were talking with Jesus.

31.verse: They appeared in heavenly glory, talking about his departure which he would soon bring about in Jerusalem.

32.verse: Peter and the others were very sleepy, but when they awoke fully, they saw the glory of Jesus and the two men standing with him.

33.verse: When Moses and Elijah were about to leave, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good that we are here. Let us make three tents—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” (Peter did not know what he was talking about.)

34.verse: While he was saying these things, a cloud came and covered them, and they became afraid as the cloud covered them.

35.verse: A voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I have chosen. Listen to him!”

36.verse: When the voice finished speaking, only Jesus was there. Peter, John, and James said nothing and told no one at that time what they had seen.

37.verse: Jesus Heals a Sick Boy - The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met Jesus.

38.verse: A man in the crowd shouted to him, “Teacher, please come and look at my son, because he is my only child.

39.verse: An evil spirit seizes my son, and suddenly he screams. It causes him to lose control of himself and foam at the mouth. The evil spirit keeps on hurting him and almost never leaves him.

40.verse: I begged your followers to force the evil spirit out, but they could not do it.”

41.verse: Jesus answered, “You people have no faith, and your lives are all wrong. How long must I stay with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”

42.verse: While the boy was coming, the demon threw him on the ground and made him lose control of himself. But Jesus gave a strong command to the evil spirit and healed the boy and gave him back to his father.

43.verse: All the people were amazed at the great power of God. Jesus Talks About His Death - While everyone was wondering about all that Jesus did, he said to his followers,

44.verse: “Don’t forget what I tell you now: The Son of Man will be handed over to people.”

45.verse: But the followers did not understand what this meant; the meaning was hidden from them so they could not understand. But they were afraid to ask Jesus about it.

46.verse: Who Is the Greatest? - Jesus’ followers began to have an argument about which one of them was the greatest.

47.verse: Jesus knew what they were thinking, so he took a little child and stood the child beside him.

48.verse: Then Jesus said, “Whoever accepts this little child in my name accepts me. And whoever accepts me accepts the One who sent me, because whoever is least among you all is really the greatest.”

49.verse: Anyone Not Against Us Is for Us - John answered, “Master, we saw someone using your name to force demons out of people. We told him to stop, because he does not belong to our group.”

50.verse: But Jesus said to him, “Don’t stop him, because whoever is not against you is for you.”

51.verse: A Town Rejects Jesus - When the time was coming near for Jesus to depart, he was determined to go to Jerusalem.

52.verse: He sent some messengers ahead of him, who went into a town in Samaria to make everything ready for him.

53.verse: But the people there would not welcome him, because he was set on going to Jerusalem.

54.verse: When James and John, followers of Jesus, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven and destroy those people?”

55.verse: But Jesus turned and scolded them. [And Jesus said, “You don’t know what kind of spirit you belong to.

56.verse: The Son of Man did not come to destroy the souls of people but to save them.”] Then they went to another town.

57.verse: Following Jesus - As they were going along the road, someone said to Jesus, “I will follow you any place you go.”

58.verse: Jesus said to them, “The foxes have holes to live in, and the birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to rest his head.”

59.verse: Jesus said to another man, “Follow me!” But he said, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”

60.verse: But Jesus said to him, “Let the people who are dead bury their own dead. You must go and tell about the kingdom of God.”

61.verse: Another man said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me go and say good-bye to my family.”

62.verse: Jesus said, “Anyone who begins to plow a field but keeps looking back is of no use in the kingdom of God.”

1.verse: Jesus Sends Out the Seventy-Two - After this, the Lord chose seventy-two others and sent them out in pairs ahead of him into every town and place where he planned to go.

2.verse: He said to them, “There are a great many people to harvest, but there are only a few workers. So pray to God, who owns the harvest, that he will send more workers to help gather his harvest.

3.verse: Go now, but listen! I am sending you out like sheep among wolves.

4.verse: Don’t carry a purse, a bag, or sandals, and don’t waste time talking with people on the road.

5.verse: Before you go into a house, say, ‘Peace be with this house.’

6.verse: If peace-loving people live there, your blessing of peace will stay with them, but if not, then your blessing will come back to you.

7.verse: Stay in the same house, eating and drinking what the people there give you. A worker should be given his pay. Don’t move from house to house.

8.verse: If you go into a town and the people welcome you, eat what they give you.

9.verse: Heal the sick who live there, and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God is near you.’

10.verse: But if you go into a town, and the people don’t welcome you, then go into the streets and say,

11.verse: ‘Even the dirt from your town that sticks to our feet we wipe off against you. But remember that the kingdom of God is near.’

12.verse: I tell you, on the Judgment Day it will be better for the people of Sodom than for the people of that town.

13.verse: Jesus Warns Unbelievers - “How terrible for you, Korazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles I did in you had happened in Tyre and Sidon, those people would have changed their lives long ago. They would have worn rough cloth and put ashes on themselves to show they had changed.

14.verse: But on the Judgment Day it will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.

15.verse: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to heaven? No! You will be thrown down to the depths!

16.verse: “Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever refuses to accept you refuses to accept me. And whoever refuses to accept me refuses to accept the One who sent me.”

17.verse: Satan Falls - When the seventy-two came back, they were very happy and said, “Lord, even the demons obeyed us when we used your name!”

18.verse: Jesus said, “I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.

19.verse: Listen, I have given you power to walk on snakes and scorpions, power that is greater than the enemy has. So nothing will hurt you.

20.verse: But you should not be happy because the spirits obey you but because your names are written in heaven.”

21.verse: Jesus Prays to the Father - Then Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the people who are wise and smart. But you have shown them to those who are like little children. Yes, Father, this is what you really wanted.

22.verse: “My Father has given me all things. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father. And no one knows who the Father is, except the Son and those whom the Son chooses to tell.”

23.verse: Then Jesus turned to his followers and said privately, “You are blessed to see what you now see.

24.verse: I tell you, many prophets and kings wanted to see what you now see, but they did not, and they wanted to hear what you now hear, but they did not.”

25.verse: The Good Samaritan - Then an expert on the law stood up to test Jesus, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to get life forever?”

26.verse: Jesus said, “What is written in the law? What do you read there?”

27.verse: The man answered, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, all your strength, and all your mind.” Also, “Love your neighbor as you love yourself.”

28.verse: Jesus said to him, “Your answer is right. Do this and you will live.”

29.verse: But the man, wanting to show the importance of his question, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”

30.verse: Jesus answered, “As a man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, some robbers attacked him. They tore off his clothes, beat him, and left him lying there, almost dead.

31.verse: It happened that a priest was going down that road. When he saw the man, he walked by on the other side.

32.verse: Next, a Levite came there, and after he went over and looked at the man, he walked by on the other side of the road.

33.verse: Then a Samaritan traveling down the road came to where the hurt man was. When he saw the man, he felt very sorry for him.

34.verse: The Samaritan went to him, poured olive oil and wine on his wounds, and bandaged them. Then he put the hurt man on his own donkey and took him to an inn where he cared for him.

35.verse: The next day, the Samaritan brought out two coins, gave them to the innkeeper, and said, ‘Take care of this man. If you spend more money on him, I will pay it back to you when I come again.’”

36.verse: Then Jesus said, “Which one of these three men do you think was a neighbor to the man who was attacked by the robbers?”

37.verse: The expert on the law answered, “The one who showed him mercy.” Jesus said to him, “Then go and do what he did.”

38.verse: Mary and Martha - While Jesus and his followers were traveling, Jesus went into a town. A woman named Martha let Jesus stay at her house.

39.verse: Martha had a sister named Mary, who was sitting at Jesus’ feet and listening to him teach.

40.verse: But Martha was busy with all the work to be done. She went in and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me alone to do all the work? Tell her to help me.”

41.verse: But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and upset about many things.

42.verse: Only one thing is important. Mary has chosen the better thing, and it will never be taken away from her.”

1.verse: Jesus Teaches About Prayer - One time Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his followers said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray as John taught his followers.”

2.verse: Jesus said to them, “When you pray, say: ‘Father, may your name always be kept holy. May your kingdom come.

3.verse: Give us the food we need for each day.

4.verse: Forgive us for our sins, because we forgive everyone who has done wrong to us. And do not cause us to be tempted.’”

5.verse: Continue to Ask - Then Jesus said to them, “Suppose one of you went to your friend’s house at midnight and said to him, ‘Friend, loan me three loaves of bread.

6.verse: A friend of mine has come into town to visit me, but I have nothing for him to eat.’

7.verse: Your friend inside the house answers, ‘Don’t bother me! The door is already locked, and my children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything.’

8.verse: I tell you, if friendship is not enough to make him get up to give you the bread, your boldness will make him get up and give you whatever you need.

9.verse: So I tell you, ask, and God will give to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will open for you.

10.verse: Yes, everyone who asks will receive. The one who searches will find. And everyone who knocks will have the door opened.

11.verse: If your children ask for a fish, which of you would give them a snake instead?

12.verse: Or, if your children ask for an egg, would you give them a scorpion?

13.verse: Even though you are bad, you know how to give good things to your children. How much more your heavenly Father will give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”

14.verse: Jesus’ Power Is from God - One time Jesus was sending out a demon who could not talk. When the demon came out, the man who had been unable to speak, then spoke. The people were amazed.

15.verse: But some of them said, “Jesus uses the power of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons, to force demons out of people.”

16.verse: Other people, wanting to test Jesus, asked him to give them a sign from heaven.

17.verse: But knowing their thoughts, he said to them, “Every kingdom that is divided against itself will be destroyed. And a family that is divided against itself will not continue.

18.verse: So if Satan is divided against himself, his kingdom will not continue. You say that I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons.

19.verse: But if I use the power of Beelzebul to force out demons, what power do your people use to force demons out? So they will be your judges.

20.verse: But if I use the power of God to force out demons, then the kingdom of God has come to you.

21.verse: “When a strong person with many weapons guards his own house, his possessions are safe.

22.verse: But when someone stronger comes and defeats him, the stronger one will take away the weapons the first man trusted and will give away the possessions.

23.verse: “Anyone who is not with me is against me, and anyone who does not work with me is working against me.

24.verse: The Empty Person - “When an evil spirit comes out of a person, it travels through dry places, looking for a place to rest. But when it finds no place, it says, ‘I will go back to the house I left.’

25.verse: And when it comes back, it finds that house swept clean and made neat.

26.verse: Then the evil spirit goes out and brings seven other spirits more evil than it is, and they go in and live there. So the person has even more trouble than before.”

27.verse: People Who Are Truly Blessed - As Jesus was saying these things, a woman in the crowd called out to Jesus, “Blessed is the mother who gave birth to you and nursed you.”

28.verse: But Jesus said, “No, blessed are those who hear the teaching of God and obey it.”

29.verse: The People Want a Miracle - As the crowd grew larger, Jesus said, “The people who live today are evil. They want to see a miracle for a sign, but no sign will be given them, except the sign of Jonah.

30.verse: As Jonah was a sign for those people who lived in Nineveh, the Son of Man will be a sign for the people of this time.

31.verse: On the Judgment Day the Queen of the South will stand up with the people who live now. She will show they are guilty, because she came from far away to listen to Solomon’s wise teaching. And I tell you that someone greater than Solomon is here.

32.verse: On the Judgment Day the people of Nineveh will stand up with the people who live now, and they will show that you are guilty. When Jonah preached to them, they were sorry and changed their lives. And I tell you that someone greater than Jonah is here.

33.verse: Be a Light for the World - “No one lights a lamp and puts it in a secret place or under a bowl, but on a lampstand so the people who come in can see.

34.verse: Your eye is a light for the body. When your eyes are good, your whole body will be full of light. But when your eyes are evil, your whole body will be full of darkness.

35.verse: So be careful not to let the light in you become darkness.

36.verse: If your whole body is full of light, and none of it is dark, then you will shine bright, as when a lamp shines on you.”

37.verse: Jesus Accuses the Pharisees - After Jesus had finished speaking, a Pharisee asked Jesus to eat with him. So Jesus went in and sat at the table.

38.verse: But the Pharisee was surprised when he saw that Jesus did not wash his hands before the meal.

39.verse: The Lord said to him, “You Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the dish, but inside you are full of greed and evil.

40.verse: You foolish people! The same one who made what is outside also made what is inside.

41.verse: So give what is in your dishes to the poor, and then you will be fully clean.

42.verse: How terrible for you Pharisees! You give God one-tenth of even your mint, your rue, and every other plant in your garden. But you fail to be fair to others and to love God. These are the things you should do while continuing to do those other things.

43.verse: How terrible for you Pharisees, because you love to have the most important seats in the synagogues, and you love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces.

44.verse: How terrible for you, because you are like hidden graves, which people walk on without knowing.”

45.verse: Jesus Talks to Experts on the Law - One of the experts on the law said to Jesus, “Teacher, when you say these things, you are insulting us, too.”

46.verse: Jesus answered, “How terrible for you, you experts on the law! You make strict rules that are very hard for people to obey, but you yourselves don’t even try to follow those rules.

47.verse: How terrible for you, because you build tombs for the prophets whom your ancestors killed!

48.verse: And now you show that you approve of what your ancestors did. They killed the prophets, and you build tombs for them!

49.verse: This is why in his wisdom God said, ‘I will send prophets and apostles to them. They will kill some, and they will treat others cruelly.’

50.verse: So you who live now will be punished for the deaths of all the prophets who were killed since the beginning of the world—

51.verse: from the killing of Abel to the killing of Zechariah, who died between the altar and the Temple. Yes, I tell you that you who are alive now will be punished for them all.

52.verse: “How terrible for you, you experts on the law. You have taken away the key to learning about God. You yourselves would not learn, and you stopped others from learning, too.”

53.verse: When Jesus left, the teachers of the law and the Pharisees began to give him trouble, asking him questions about many things,

54.verse: trying to catch him saying something wrong.

1.verse: Don’t Be Like the Pharisees - So many thousands of people had gathered that they were stepping on each other. Jesus spoke first to his followers, saying, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, because they are hypocrites.

2.verse: Everything that is hidden will be shown, and everything that is secret will be made known.

3.verse: What you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in an inner room will be shouted from the housetops.

4.verse: “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of people who can kill the body but after that can do nothing more to hurt you.

5.verse: I will show you the one to fear. Fear the one who has the power to kill you and also to throw you into hell. Yes, this is the one you should fear.

6.verse: “Five sparrows are sold for only two pennies, and God does not forget any of them.

7.verse: But God even knows how many hairs you have on your head. Don’t be afraid. You are worth much more than many sparrows.

8.verse: Don’t Be Ashamed of Jesus - “I tell you, all those who stand before others and say they believe in me, I, the Son of Man, will say before the angels of God that they belong to me.

9.verse: But all who stand before others and say they do not believe in me, I will say before the angels of God that they do not belong to me.

10.verse: “Anyone who speaks against the Son of Man can be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

11.verse: “When you are brought into the synagogues before the leaders and other powerful people, don’t worry about how to defend yourself or what to say.

12.verse: At that time the Holy Spirit will teach you what you must say.”

13.verse: Jesus Warns Against Selfishness - Someone in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide with me the property our father left us.”

14.verse: But Jesus said to him, “Who said I should judge or decide between you?”

15.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Be careful and guard against all kinds of greed. Life is not measured by how much one owns.”

16.verse: Then Jesus told this story: “There was a rich man who had some land, which grew a good crop.

17.verse: He thought to himself, ‘What will I do? I have no place to keep all my crops.’

18.verse: Then he said, ‘This is what I will do: I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and other goods.

19.verse: Then I can say to myself, “I have enough good things stored to last for many years. Rest, eat, drink, and enjoy life!”’

20.verse: “But God said to him, ‘Foolish man! Tonight your life will be taken from you. So who will get those things you have prepared for yourself?’

21.verse: “This is how it will be for those who store up things for themselves and are not rich toward God.”

22.verse: Don’t Worry - Jesus said to his followers, “So I tell you, don’t worry about the food you need to live, or about the clothes you need for your body.

23.verse: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.

24.verse: Look at the birds. They don’t plant or harvest, they don’t have storerooms or barns, but God feeds them. And you are worth much more than birds.

25.verse: You cannot add any time to your life by worrying about it.

26.verse: If you cannot do even the little things, then why worry about the big things?

27.verse: Consider how the lilies grow; they don’t work or make clothes for themselves. But I tell you that even Solomon with his riches was not dressed as beautifully as one of these flowers.

28.verse: God clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today but tomorrow is thrown into the fire. So how much more will God clothe you? Don’t have so little faith!

29.verse: Don’t always think about what you will eat or what you will drink, and don’t keep worrying.

30.verse: All the people in the world are trying to get these things, and your Father knows you need them.

31.verse: But seek God’s kingdom, and all your other needs will be met as well.

32.verse: Don’t Trust in Money - “Don’t fear, little flock, because your Father wants to give you the kingdom.
