33.verse: Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Get for yourselves purses that will not wear out, the treasure in heaven that never runs out, where thieves can’t steal and moths can’t destroy.

34.verse: Your heart will be where your treasure is.

35.verse: Always Be Ready - “Be dressed, ready for service, and have your lamps shining.

36.verse: Be like servants who are waiting for their master to come home from a wedding party. When he comes and knocks, the servants immediately open the door for him.

37.verse: They will be blessed when their master comes home, because he sees that they were watching for him. I tell you the truth, the master will dress himself to serve and tell the servants to sit at the table, and he will serve them.

38.verse: Those servants will be blessed when he comes in and finds them still waiting, even if it is midnight or later.

39.verse: “Remember this: If the owner of the house knew what time a thief was coming, he would not allow the thief to enter his house.

40.verse: So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at a time when you don’t expect him!”

41.verse: Who Is the Trusted Servant? - Peter said, “Lord, did you tell this story to us or to all people?”

42.verse: The Lord said, “Who is the wise and trusted servant that the master trusts to give the other servants their food at the right time?

43.verse: When the master comes and finds the servant doing his work, the servant will be blessed.

44.verse: I tell you the truth, the master will choose that servant to take care of everything he owns.

45.verse: But suppose the servant thinks to himself, ‘My master will not come back soon,’ and he begins to beat the other servants, men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk.

46.verse: The master will come when that servant is not ready and is not expecting him. Then the master will cut him in pieces and send him away to be with the others who don’t obey.

47.verse: “The servant who knows what his master wants but is not ready, or who does not do what the master wants, will be beaten with many blows!

48.verse: But the servant who does not know what his master wants and does things that should be punished will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded. And from the one trusted with much, much more will be expected.

49.verse: Jesus Causes Division - “I came to set fire to the world, and I wish it were already burning!

50.verse: I have a baptism to suffer through, and I feel very troubled until it is over.

51.verse: Do you think I came to give peace to the earth? No, I tell you, I came to divide it.

52.verse: From now on, a family with five people will be divided, three against two, and two against three.

53.verse: They will be divided: father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”

54.verse: Understanding the Times - Then Jesus said to the people, “When you see clouds coming up in the west, you say, ‘It’s going to rain,’ and it happens.

55.verse: When you feel the wind begin to blow from the south, you say, ‘It will be a hot day,’ and it happens.

56.verse: Hypocrites! You know how to understand the appearance of the earth and sky. Why don’t you understand what is happening now?

57.verse: Settle Your Problems - “Why can’t you decide for yourselves what is right?

58.verse: If your enemy is taking you to court, try hard to settle it on the way. If you don’t, your enemy might take you to the judge, and the judge might turn you over to the officer, and the officer might throw you into jail.

59.verse: I tell you, you will not get out of there until you have paid everything you owe.”

1.verse: Change Your Hearts - At that time some people were there who told Jesus that Pilate had killed some people from Galilee while they were worshiping. He mixed their blood with the blood of the animals they were sacrificing to God.

2.verse: Jesus answered, “Do you think this happened to them because they were more sinful than all others from Galilee?

3.verse: No, I tell you. But unless you change your hearts and lives, you will be destroyed as they were!

4.verse: What about those eighteen people who died when the tower of Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were more sinful than all the others who live in Jerusalem?

5.verse: No, I tell you. But unless you change your hearts and lives, you will all be destroyed too!”

6.verse: The Useless Tree - Jesus told this story: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came looking for some fruit on the tree, but he found none.

7.verse: So the man said to his gardener, ‘I have been looking for fruit on this tree for three years, but I never find any. Cut it down. Why should it waste the ground?’

8.verse: But the servant answered, ‘Master, let the tree have one more year to produce fruit. Let me dig up the dirt around it and put on some fertilizer.

9.verse: If the tree produces fruit next year, good. But if not, you can cut it down.’”

10.verse: Jesus Heals on the Sabbath - Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.

11.verse: A woman was there who, for eighteen years, had an evil spirit in her that made her crippled. Her back was always bent; she could not stand up straight.

12.verse: When Jesus saw her, he called her over and said, “Woman, you are free from your sickness.”

13.verse: Jesus put his hands on her, and immediately she was able to stand up straight and began praising God.

14.verse: The synagogue leader was angry because Jesus healed on the Sabbath day. He said to the people, “There are six days when one has to work. So come to be healed on one of those days, and not on the Sabbath day.”

15.verse: The Lord answered, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you untie your work animals and lead them to drink water every day—even on the Sabbath day?

16.verse: This woman that I healed, a daughter of Abraham, has been held by Satan for eighteen years. Surely it is not wrong for her to be freed from her sickness on a Sabbath day!”

17.verse: When Jesus said this, all of those who were criticizing him were ashamed, but the entire crowd rejoiced at all the wonderful things Jesus was doing.

18.verse: Stories of Mustard Seed and Yeast - Then Jesus said, “What is God’s kingdom like? What can I compare it with?

19.verse: It is like a mustard seed that a man plants in his garden. The seed grows and becomes a tree, and the wild birds build nests in its branches.”

20.verse: Jesus said again, “What can I compare God’s kingdom with?

21.verse: It is like yeast that a woman took and hid in a large tub of flour until it made all the dough rise.”

22.verse: The Narrow Door - Jesus was teaching in every town and village as he traveled toward Jerusalem.

23.verse: Someone said to Jesus, “Lord, will only a few people be saved?” Jesus said,

24.verse: “Try hard to enter through the narrow door, because many people will try to enter there, but they will not be able.

25.verse: When the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you can stand outside and knock on the door and say, ‘Sir, open the door for us.’ But he will answer, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’

26.verse: Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in the streets of our town.’

27.verse: But he will say to you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from. Go away from me, all you who do evil!’

28.verse: You will cry and grind your teeth with pain when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in God’s kingdom, but you yourselves thrown outside.

29.verse: People will come from the east, west, north, and south and will sit down at the table in the kingdom of God.

30.verse: There are those who are last now who will be first in the future. And there are those who are first now who will be last in the future.”

31.verse: Jesus Will Die in Jerusalem - At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said, “Go away from here! Herod wants to kill you!”

32.verse: Jesus said to them, “Go tell that fox Herod, ‘Today and tomorrow I am forcing demons out and healing people. Then, on the third day, I will reach my goal.’

33.verse: Yet I must be on my way today and tomorrow and the next day. Surely it cannot be right for a prophet to be killed anywhere except in Jerusalem.

34.verse: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem! You kill the prophets and stone to death those who are sent to you. Many times I wanted to gather your people as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would not let me.

35.verse: Now your house is left completely empty. I tell you, you will not see me until that time when you will say, ‘God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord.’”

1.verse: Healing on the Sabbath - On a Sabbath day, when Jesus went to eat at the home of a leading Pharisee, the people were watching Jesus very closely.

2.verse: And in front of him was a man with dropsy.

3.verse: Jesus said to the Pharisees and experts on the law, “Is it right or wrong to heal on the Sabbath day?”

4.verse: But they would not answer his question. So Jesus took the man, healed him, and sent him away.

5.verse: Jesus said to the Pharisees and teachers of the law, “If your child or ox falls into a well on the Sabbath day, will you not pull him out quickly?”

6.verse: And they could not answer him.

7.verse: Don’t Make Yourself Important - When Jesus noticed that some of the guests were choosing the best places to sit, he told this story:

8.verse: “When someone invites you to a wedding feast, don’t take the most important seat, because someone more important than you may have been invited.

9.verse: The host, who invited both of you, will come to you and say, ‘Give this person your seat.’ Then you will be embarrassed and will have to move to the last place.

10.verse: So when you are invited, go sit in a seat that is not important. When the host comes to you, he may say, ‘Friend, move up here to a more important place.’ Then all the other guests will respect you.

11.verse: All who make themselves great will be made humble, but those who make themselves humble will be made great.”

12.verse: You Will Be Rewarded - Then Jesus said to the man who had invited him, “When you give a lunch or a dinner, don’t invite only your friends, your family, your other relatives, and your rich neighbors. At another time they will invite you to eat with them, and you will be repaid.

13.verse: Instead, when you give a feast, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind.

14.verse: Then you will be blessed, because they have nothing and cannot pay you back. But you will be repaid when the good people rise from the dead.”

15.verse: A Story About a Big Banquet - One of those at the table with Jesus heard these things and said to him, “Blessed are the people who will share in the meal in God’s kingdom.”

16.verse: Jesus said to him, “A man gave a big banquet and invited many people.

17.verse: When it was time to eat, the man sent his servant to tell the guests, ‘Come. Everything is ready.’

18.verse: “But all the guests made excuses. The first one said, ‘I have just bought a field, and I must go look at it. Please excuse me.’

19.verse: Another said, ‘I have just bought five pairs of oxen; I must go and try them. Please excuse me.’

20.verse: A third person said, ‘I just got married; I can’t come.’

21.verse: So the servant returned and told his master what had happened. Then the master became angry and said, ‘Go at once into the streets and alleys of the town, and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’

22.verse: Later the servant said to him, ‘Master, I did what you commanded, but we still have room.’

23.verse: The master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the roads and country lanes, and urge the people there to come so my house will be full.

24.verse: I tell you, none of those whom I invited first will eat with me.’”

25.verse: The Cost of Being Jesus’ Follower - Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and he turned and said to them,

26.verse: “If anyone comes to me but loves his father, mother, wife, children, brothers, or sisters—or even life—more than me, he cannot be my follower.

27.verse: Whoever is not willing to carry his cross and follow me cannot be my follower.

28.verse: If you want to build a tower, you first sit down and decide how much it will cost, to see if you have enough money to finish the job.

29.verse: If you don’t, you might lay the foundation, but you would not be able to finish. Then all who would see it would make fun of you,

30.verse: saying, ‘This person began to build but was not able to finish.’

31.verse: “If a king is going to fight another king, first he will sit down and plan. He will decide if he and his ten thousand soldiers can defeat the other king who has twenty thousand soldiers.

32.verse: If he can’t, then while the other king is still far away, he will send some people to speak to him and ask for peace.

33.verse: In the same way, you must give up everything you have to be my follower.

34.verse: Don’t Lose Your Influence - “Salt is good, but if it loses its salty taste, you cannot make it salty again.

35.verse: It is no good for the soil or for manure; it is thrown away. “Let those with ears use them and listen.”

1.verse: A Lost Sheep, a Lost Coin - The tax collectors and sinners all came to listen to Jesus.

2.verse: But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law began to complain: “Look, this man welcomes sinners and even eats with them.”

3.verse: Then Jesus told them this story:

4.verse: “Suppose one of you has a hundred sheep but loses one of them. Then he will leave the other ninety-nine sheep in the open field and go out and look for the lost sheep until he finds it.

5.verse: And when he finds it, he happily puts it on his shoulders

6.verse: and goes home. He calls to his friends and neighbors and says, ‘Be happy with me because I found my lost sheep.’

7.verse: In the same way, I tell you there is more joy in heaven over one sinner who changes his heart and life, than over ninety-nine good people who don’t need to change.

8.verse: “Suppose a woman has ten silver coins, but loses one. She will light a lamp, sweep the house, and look carefully for the coin until she finds it.

9.verse: And when she finds it, she will call her friends and neighbors and say, ‘Be happy with me because I have found the coin that I lost.’

10.verse: In the same way, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God when one sinner changes his heart and life.”

11.verse: The Son Who Left Home - Then Jesus said, “A man had two sons.

12.verse: The younger son said to his father, ‘Give me my share of the property.’ So the father divided the property between his two sons.

13.verse: Then the younger son gathered up all that was his and traveled far away to another country. There he wasted his money in foolish living.

14.verse: After he had spent everything, a time came when there was no food anywhere in the country, and the son was poor and hungry.

15.verse: So he got a job with one of the citizens there who sent the son into the fields to feed pigs.

16.verse: The son was so hungry that he wanted to eat the pods the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.

17.verse: When he realized what he was doing, he thought, ‘All of my father’s servants have plenty of food. But I am here, almost dying with hunger.

18.verse: I will leave and return to my father and say to him, “Father, I have sinned against God and against you.

19.verse: I am no longer worthy to be called your son, but let me be like one of your servants.”’

20.verse: So the son left and went to his father. “While the son was still a long way off, his father saw him and felt sorry for his son. So the father ran to him and hugged and kissed him.

21.verse: The son said, ‘Father, I have sinned against God and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

22.verse: But the father said to his servants, ‘Hurry! Bring the best clothes and put them on him. Also, put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.

23.verse: And get our fat calf and kill it so we can have a feast and celebrate.

24.verse: My son was dead, but now he is alive again! He was lost, but now he is found!’ So they began to celebrate.

25.verse: “The older son was in the field, and as he came closer to the house, he heard the sound of music and dancing.

26.verse: So he called to one of the servants and asked what all this meant.

27.verse: The servant said, ‘Your brother has come back, and your father killed the fat calf, because your brother came home safely.’

28.verse: The older son was angry and would not go in to the feast. So his father went out and begged him to come in.

29.verse: But the older son said to his father, ‘I have served you like a slave for many years and have always obeyed your commands. But you never gave me even a young goat to have at a feast with my friends.

30.verse: But your other son, who wasted all your money on prostitutes, comes home, and you kill the fat calf for him!’

31.verse: The father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.

32.verse: We had to celebrate and be happy because your brother was dead, but now he is alive. He was lost, but now he is found.’”

1.verse: True Wealth - Jesus also said to his followers, “Once there was a rich man who had a manager to take care of his business. This manager was accused of cheating him.

2.verse: So he called the manager in and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give me a report of what you have done with my money, because you can’t be my manager any longer.’

3.verse: The manager thought to himself, ‘What will I do since my master is taking my job away from me? I am not strong enough to dig ditches, and I am ashamed to beg.

4.verse: I know what I’ll do so that when I lose my job people will welcome me into their homes.’

5.verse: “So the manager called in everyone who owed the master any money. He asked the first one, ‘How much do you owe?’

6.verse: He answered, ‘Eight hundred gallons of olive oil.’ The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write four hundred gallons.’

7.verse: Then the manager asked another one, ‘How much do you owe?’ He answered, ‘One thousand bushels of wheat.’ Then the manager said to him, ‘Take your bill and write eight hundred bushels.’

8.verse: So, the master praised the dishonest manager for being clever. Yes, worldly people are more clever with their own kind than spiritual people are.

9.verse: “I tell you, make friends for yourselves using worldly riches so that when those riches are gone, you will be welcomed in those homes that continue forever.

10.verse: Whoever can be trusted with a little can also be trusted with a lot, and whoever is dishonest with a little is dishonest with a lot.

11.verse: If you cannot be trusted with worldly riches, then who will trust you with true riches?

12.verse: And if you cannot be trusted with things that belong to someone else, who will give you things of your own?

13.verse: “No servant can serve two masters. The servant will hate one master and love the other, or will follow one master and refuse to follow the other. You cannot serve both God and worldly riches.”

14.verse: God’s Law Cannot Be Changed - The Pharisees, who loved money, were listening to all these things and made fun of Jesus.

15.verse: He said to them, “You make yourselves look good in front of people, but God knows what is really in your hearts. What is important to people is hateful in God’s sight.

16.verse: “The law of Moses and the writings of the prophets were preached until John came. Since then the Good News about the kingdom of God is being told, and everyone tries to enter it by force.

17.verse: It would be easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for the smallest part of a letter in the law to be changed.

18.verse: Divorce and Remarriage - “If a man divorces his wife and marries another woman, he is guilty of adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman is also guilty of adultery.”

19.verse: The Rich Man and Lazarus - Jesus said, “There was a rich man who always dressed in the finest clothes and lived in luxury every day.

20.verse: And a very poor man named Lazarus, whose body was covered with sores, was laid at the rich man’s gate.

21.verse: He wanted to eat only the small pieces of food that fell from the rich man’s table. And the dogs would come and lick his sores.

22.verse: Later, Lazarus died, and the angels carried him to the arms of Abraham. The rich man died, too, and was buried.

23.verse: In the place of the dead, he was in much pain. The rich man saw Abraham far away with Lazarus at his side.

24.verse: He called, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to dip his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am suffering in this fire!’

25.verse: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember when you were alive you had the good things in life, but bad things happened to Lazarus. Now he is comforted here, and you are suffering.

26.verse: Besides, there is a big pit between you and us, so no one can cross over to you, and no one can leave there and come here.’

27.verse: The rich man said, ‘Father, then please send Lazarus to my father’s house.

28.verse: I have five brothers, and Lazarus could warn them so that they will not come to this place of pain.’

29.verse: But Abraham said, ‘They have the law of Moses and the writings of the prophets; let them learn from them.’

30.verse: The rich man said, ‘No, father Abraham! If someone goes to them from the dead, they would believe and change their hearts and lives.’

31.verse: But Abraham said to him, ‘If they will not listen to Moses and the prophets, they will not listen to someone who comes back from the dead.’”

1.verse: Sin and Forgiveness - Jesus said to his followers, “Things that cause people to sin will happen, but how terrible for the person who causes them to happen!

2.verse: It would be better for you to be thrown into the sea with a large stone around your neck than to cause one of these little ones to sin.

3.verse: So be careful! “If another follower sins, warn him, and if he is sorry and stops sinning, forgive him.

4.verse: If he sins against you seven times in one day and says that he is sorry each time, forgive him.”

5.verse: How Big Is Your Faith? - The apostles said to the Lord, “Give us more faith!”

6.verse: The Lord said, “If your faith were the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Dig yourself up and plant yourself in the sea,’ and it would obey you.

7.verse: Be Good Servants - “Suppose one of you has a servant who has been plowing the ground or caring for the sheep. When the servant comes in from working in the field, would you say, ‘Come in and sit down to eat’?

8.verse: No, you would say to him, ‘Prepare something for me to eat. Then get yourself ready and serve me. After I finish eating and drinking, you can eat.’

9.verse: The servant does not get any special thanks for doing what his master commanded.

10.verse: It is the same with you. When you have done everything you are told to do, you should say, ‘We are unworthy servants; we have only done the work we should do.’”

11.verse: Be Thankful - While Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem, he was going through the area between Samaria and Galilee.

12.verse: As he came into a small town, ten men who had a skin disease met him there. They did not come close to Jesus

13.verse: but called to him, “Jesus! Master! Have mercy on us!”

14.verse: When Jesus saw the men, he said, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” As the ten men were going, they were healed.

15.verse: When one of them saw that he was healed, he went back to Jesus, praising God in a loud voice.

16.verse: Then he bowed down at Jesus’ feet and thanked him. (And this man was a Samaritan.)

17.verse: Jesus said, “Weren’t ten men healed? Where are the other nine?

18.verse: Is this Samaritan the only one who came back to thank God?”

19.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Stand up and go on your way. You were healed because you believed.”

20.verse: God’s Kingdom Is Within You - Some of the Pharisees asked Jesus, “When will the kingdom of God come?” Jesus answered, “God’s kingdom is coming, but not in a way that you will be able to see with your eyes.

21.verse: People will not say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’ because God’s kingdom is within you.”

22.verse: Then Jesus said to his followers, “The time will come when you will want very much to see one of the days of the Son of Man. But you will not see it.

23.verse: People will say to you, ‘Look, there he is!’ or, ‘Look, here he is!’ Stay where you are; don’t go away and search.

24.verse: When Jesus Comes Again - “When the Son of Man comes again, he will shine like lightning, which flashes across the sky and lights it up from one side to the other.

25.verse: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by the people of this time.

26.verse: When the Son of Man comes again, it will be as it was when Noah lived.

27.verse: People were eating, drinking, marrying, and giving their children to be married until the day Noah entered the boat. Then the flood came and killed them all.

28.verse: It will be the same as during the time of Lot. People were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, and building.

29.verse: But the day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from the sky and killed them all.

30.verse: This is how it will be when the Son of Man comes again.

31.verse: “On that day, a person who is on the roof and whose belongings are in the house should not go inside to get them. A person who is in the field should not go back home.

32.verse: Remember Lot’s wife.

33.verse: Those who try to keep their lives will lose them. But those who give up their lives will save them.

34.verse: I tell you, on that night two people will be sleeping in one bed; one will be taken and the other will be left.

35.verse: There will be two women grinding grain together; one will be taken, and the other will be left. [

36.verse: Two people will be in the field. One will be taken, and the other will be left.]”

37.verse: The followers asked Jesus, “Where will this be, Lord?” Jesus answered, “Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather.”

1.verse: God Will Answer His People - Then Jesus used this story to teach his followers that they should always pray and never lose hope.

2.verse: “In a certain town there was a judge who did not respect God or care about people.

3.verse: In that same town there was a widow who kept coming to this judge, saying, ‘Give me my rights against my enemy.’

4.verse: For a while the judge refused to help her. But afterwards, he thought to himself, ‘Even though I don’t respect God or care about people,

5.verse: I will see that she gets her rights. Otherwise she will continue to bother me until I am worn out.’”

6.verse: The Lord said, “Listen to what the unfair judge said.

7.verse: God will always give what is right to his people who cry to him night and day, and he will not be slow to answer them.

8.verse: I tell you, God will help his people quickly. But when the Son of Man comes again, will he find those on earth who believe in him?”

9.verse: Being Right with God - Jesus told this story to some people who thought they were very good and looked down on everyone else:

10.verse: “A Pharisee and a tax collector both went to the Temple to pray.

11.verse: The Pharisee stood alone and prayed, ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people who steal, cheat, or take part in adultery, or even like this tax collector.

12.verse: I fast twice a week, and I give one-tenth of everything I get!’

13.verse: “The tax collector, standing at a distance, would not even look up to heaven. But he beat on his chest because he was so sad. He said, ‘God, have mercy on me, a sinner.’

14.verse: I tell you, when this man went home, he was right with God, but the Pharisee was not. All who make themselves great will be made humble, but all who make themselves humble will be made great.”

15.verse: Who Will Enter God’s Kingdom? - Some people brought even their babies to Jesus so he could touch them. When the followers saw this, they told them to stop.

16.verse: But Jesus called for the children, saying, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because the kingdom of God belongs to people who are like these children.

17.verse: I tell you the truth, you must accept the kingdom of God as if you were a child, or you will never enter it.”

18.verse: A Rich Man’s Question - A certain leader asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life forever?”

19.verse: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? Only God is good.

20.verse: You know the commands: ‘You must not be guilty of adultery. You must not murder anyone. You must not steal. You must not tell lies about your neighbor. Honor your father and mother.’”

21.verse: But the leader said, “I have obeyed all these commands since I was a boy.”

22.verse: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “There is still one more thing you need to do. Sell everything you have and give it to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”

23.verse: But when the man heard this, he became very sad, because he was very rich.

24.verse: Jesus looked at him and said, “It is very hard for rich people to enter the kingdom of God.

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: Who Can Be Saved? - When the people heard this, they asked, “Then who can be saved?”

27.verse: Jesus answered, “The things impossible for people are possible for God.”

28.verse: Peter said, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”

29.verse: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, all those who have left houses, wives, brothers, parents, or children for the kingdom of God

30.verse: will get much more in this life. And in the age that is coming, they will have life forever.”

31.verse: Jesus Will Rise from the Dead - Then Jesus took the twelve apostles aside and said to them, “We are going to Jerusalem. Everything the prophets wrote about the Son of Man will happen.

32.verse: He will be turned over to those who are evil. They will laugh at him, insult him, spit on him,

33.verse: beat him with whips, and kill him. But on the third day, he will rise to life again.”

34.verse: The apostles did not understand this; the meaning was hidden from them, and they did not realize what was said.

35.verse: Jesus Heals a Blind Man - As Jesus came near the city of Jericho, a blind man was sitting beside the road, begging.

36.verse: When he heard the people coming down the road, he asked, “What is happening?”

37.verse: They told him, “Jesus, from Nazareth, is going by.”

38.verse: The blind man cried out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”

39.verse: The people leading the group warned the blind man to be quiet. But the blind man shouted even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

40.verse: Jesus stopped and ordered the blind man to be brought to him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,

41.verse: “What do you want me to do for you?” He said, “Lord, I want to see.”

42.verse: Jesus said to him, “Then see. You are healed because you believed.”

43.verse: At once the man was able to see, and he followed Jesus, thanking God. All the people who saw this praised God.

1.verse: Zacchaeus Meets Jesus - Jesus was going through the city of Jericho.

2.verse: A man was there named Zacchaeus, who was a very important tax collector, and he was wealthy.

3.verse: He wanted to see who Jesus was, but he was not able because he was too short to see above the crowd.

4.verse: He ran ahead to a place where Jesus would come, and he climbed a sycamore tree so he could see him.

5.verse: When Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down! I must stay at your house today.”

6.verse: Zacchaeus came down quickly and welcomed him gladly.

7.verse: All the people saw this and began to complain, “Jesus is staying with a sinner!”

8.verse: But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “I will give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have cheated anyone, I will pay back four times more.”

9.verse: Jesus said to him, “Salvation has come to this house today, because this man also belongs to the family of Abraham.

10.verse: The Son of Man came to find lost people and save them.”

11.verse: A Story About Three Servants - As the people were listening to this, Jesus told them a story because he was near Jerusalem and they thought God’s kingdom would appear immediately.

12.verse: He said: “A very important man went to a country far away to be made a king and then to return home.

13.verse: So he called ten of his servants and gave a coin to each servant. He said, ‘Do business with this money until I get back.’

14.verse: But the people in the kingdom hated the man. So they sent a group to follow him and say, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’

15.verse: “But the man became king. When he returned home, he said, ‘Call those servants who have my money so I can know how much they earned with it.’

16.verse: “The first servant came and said, ‘Sir, I earned ten coins with the one you gave me.’

17.verse: The king said to the servant, ‘Excellent! You are a good servant. Since I can trust you with small things, I will let you rule over ten of my cities.’

18.verse: “The second servant said, ‘Sir, I earned five coins with your one.’

19.verse: The king said to this servant, ‘You can rule over five cities.’

20.verse: “Then another servant came in and said to the king, ‘Sir, here is your coin which I wrapped in a piece of cloth and hid.

21.verse: I was afraid of you, because you are a hard man. You even take money that you didn’t earn and gather food that you didn’t plant.’

22.verse: Then the king said to the servant, ‘I will condemn you by your own words, you evil servant. You knew that I am a hard man, taking money that I didn’t earn and gathering food that I didn’t plant.

23.verse: Why then didn’t you put my money in the bank? Then when I came back, my money would have earned some interest.’

24.verse: “The king said to the men who were standing by, ‘Take the coin away from this servant and give it to the servant who earned ten coins.’

25.verse: They said, ‘But sir, that servant already has ten coins.’

26.verse: The king said, ‘Those who have will be given more, but those who do not have anything will have everything taken away from them.

27.verse: Now where are my enemies who didn’t want me to be king? Bring them here and kill them before me.’”

28.verse: Jesus Enters Jerusalem as a King - After Jesus said this, he went on toward Jerusalem.

29.verse: As Jesus came near Bethphage and Bethany, towns near the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent out two of his followers.

30.verse: He said, “Go to the town you can see there. When you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here to me.

31.verse: If anyone asks you why you are untying it, say that the Master needs it.”

32.verse: The two followers went into town and found the colt just as Jesus had told them.

33.verse: As they were untying it, its owners came out and asked the followers, “Why are you untying our colt?”

34.verse: The followers answered, “The Master needs it.”

35.verse: So they brought it to Jesus, threw their coats on the colt’s back, and put Jesus on it.

36.verse: As Jesus rode toward Jerusalem, others spread their coats on the road before him.

37.verse: As he was coming close to Jerusalem, on the way down the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of followers began joyfully shouting praise to God for all the miracles they had seen.

38.verse: They said, “God bless the king who comes in the name of the Lord! Psalm 118:26 There is peace in heaven and glory to God!”

39.verse: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell your followers not to say these things.”

40.verse: But Jesus answered, “I tell you, if my followers didn’t say these things, then the stones would cry out.”

41.verse: Jesus Cries for Jerusalem - As Jesus came near Jerusalem, he saw the city and cried for it,

42.verse: saying, “I wish you knew today what would bring you peace. But now it is hidden from you.

43.verse: The time is coming when your enemies will build a wall around you and will hold you in on all sides.

44.verse: They will destroy you and all your people, and not one stone will be left on another. All this will happen because you did not recognize the time when God came to save you.”

45.verse: Jesus Goes to the Temple - Jesus went into the Temple and began to throw out the people who were selling things there.

46.verse: He said, “It is written in the Scriptures, ‘My Temple will be a house for prayer.’ But you have changed it into a ‘hideout for robbers’!”

47.verse: Jesus taught in the Temple every day. The leading priests, the experts on the law, and some of the leaders of the people wanted to kill Jesus.

48.verse: But they did not know how they could do it, because all the people were listening closely to him.

1.verse: Jewish Leaders Question Jesus - One day Jesus was in the Temple, teaching the people and telling them the Good News. The leading priests, teachers of the law, and elders came up to talk with him,

2.verse: saying, “Tell us what authority you have to do these things? Who gave you this authority?”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “I will also ask you a question. Tell me:

4.verse: When John baptized people, was that authority from God or just from other people?”

5.verse: They argued about this, saying, “If we answer, ‘John’s baptism was from God,’ Jesus will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’

6.verse: But if we say, ‘It was from other people,’ all the people will stone us to death, because they believe John was a prophet.”

7.verse: So they answered that they didn’t know where it came from.

8.verse: Jesus said to them, “Then I won’t tell you what authority I have to do these things.”

9.verse: A Story About God’s Son - Then Jesus told the people this story: “A man planted a vineyard and leased it to some farmers. Then he went away for a long time.

10.verse: When it was time for the grapes to be picked, he sent a servant to the farmers to get some of the grapes. But they beat the servant and sent him away empty-handed.

11.verse: Then he sent another servant. They beat this servant also, and showed no respect for him, and sent him away empty-handed.

12.verse: So the man sent a third servant. The farmers wounded him and threw him out.

13.verse: The owner of the vineyard said, ‘What will I do now? I will send my son whom I love. Maybe they will respect him.’

14.verse: But when the farmers saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This son will inherit the vineyard. If we kill him, it will be ours.’

15.verse: So the farmers threw the son out of the vineyard and killed him. “What will the owner of this vineyard do to them?

16.verse: He will come and kill those farmers and will give the vineyard to other farmers.” When the people heard this story, they said, “Let this never happen!”

17.verse: But Jesus looked at them and said, “Then what does this verse mean: ‘The stone that the builders rejected became the cornerstone’? Psalm 118:22

18.verse: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken, and the person on whom it falls, that person will be crushed!”

19.verse: The teachers of the law and the leading priests wanted to arrest Jesus at once, because they knew the story was about them. But they were afraid of what the people would do.

20.verse: Is It Right to Pay Taxes or Not? - So they watched Jesus and sent some spies who acted as if they were sincere. They wanted to trap Jesus in saying something wrong so they could hand him over to the authority and power of the governor.

21.verse: So the spies asked Jesus, “Teacher, we know that what you say and teach is true. You pay no attention to who people are, and you always teach the truth about God’s way.

22.verse: Tell us, is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”

23.verse: But Jesus, knowing they were trying to trick him, said,

24.verse: “Show me a coin. Whose image and name are on it?” They said, “Caesar’s.”

25.verse: Jesus said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and give to God the things that are God’s.”

26.verse: So they were not able to trap Jesus in anything he said in the presence of the people. And being amazed at his answer, they became silent.

27.verse: Some Sadducees Try to Trick Jesus - Some Sadducees, who believed people would not rise from the dead, came to Jesus.

28.verse: They asked, “Teacher, Moses wrote that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, then that man must marry the widow and have children for his brother.

29.verse: Once there were seven brothers. The first brother married and died, but had no children.

30.verse: Then the second brother married the widow, and he died.

31.verse: And the third brother married the widow, and he died. The same thing happened with all seven brothers; they died and had no children.

32.verse: Finally, the woman died also.

33.verse: Since all seven brothers had married her, whose wife will she be when people rise from the dead?”

34.verse: Jesus said to them, “On earth, people marry and are given to someone to marry.

35.verse: But those who will be worthy to be raised from the dead and live again will not marry, nor will they be given to someone to marry.

36.verse: In that life they are like angels and cannot die. They are children of God, because they have been raised from the dead.

37.verse: Even Moses clearly showed that the dead are raised to life. When he wrote about the burning bush, he said that the Lord is ‘the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

38.verse: God is the God of the living, not the dead, because all people are alive to him.”

39.verse: Some of the teachers of the law said, “Teacher, your answer was good.”

40.verse: No one was brave enough to ask him another question.

41.verse: Is the Christ the Son of David? - Then Jesus said, “Why do people say that the Christ is the Son of David?

42.verse: In the book of Psalms, David himself says: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by me at my right side,

43.verse: until I put your enemies under your control.”’ Psalm 110:1

44.verse: David calls the Christ ‘Lord,’ so how can the Christ be his son?”

45.verse: Jesus Accuses Some Leaders - While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his followers,

46.verse: “Beware of the teachers of the law. They like to walk around wearing fancy clothes, and they love for people to greet them with respect in the marketplaces. They love to have the most important seats in the synagogues and at feasts.

47.verse: But they cheat widows and steal their houses and then try to make themselves look good by saying long prayers. They will receive a greater punishment.”

1.verse: True Giving - As Jesus looked up, he saw some rich people putting their gifts into the Temple money box.

2.verse: Then he saw a poor widow putting two small copper coins into the box.

3.verse: He said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow gave more than all those rich people.

4.verse: They gave only what they did not need. This woman is very poor, but she gave all she had to live on.”

5.verse: The Temple Will Be Destroyed - Some people were talking about the Temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts offered to God. But Jesus said,

6.verse: “As for these things you are looking at, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another. Every stone will be thrown down.”

7.verse: They asked Jesus, “Teacher, when will these things happen? What will be the sign that they are about to take place?”

8.verse: Jesus said, “Be careful so you are not fooled. Many people will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the One’ and, ‘The time has come!’ But don’t follow them.

9.verse: When you hear about wars and riots, don’t be afraid, because these things must happen first, but the end will come later.”

10.verse: Then he said to them, “Nations will fight against other nations, and kingdoms against other kingdoms.

11.verse: In various places there will be great earthquakes, sicknesses, and a lack of food. Fearful events and great signs will come from heaven.

12.verse: “But before all these things happen, people will arrest you and treat you cruelly. They will judge you in their synagogues and put you in jail and force you to stand before kings and governors, because you follow me.

13.verse: But this will give you an opportunity to tell about me.

14.verse: Make up your minds not to worry ahead of time about what you will say.

15.verse: I will give you the wisdom to say things that none of your enemies will be able to stand against or prove wrong.

16.verse: Even your parents, brothers, relatives, and friends will turn against you, and they will kill some of you.

17.verse: All people will hate you because you follow me.

18.verse: But none of these things can really harm you.

19.verse: By continuing to have faith you will save your lives.

20.verse: Jerusalem Will Be Destroyed - “When you see armies all around Jerusalem, you will know it will soon be destroyed.

21.verse: At that time, the people in Judea should run away to the mountains. The people in Jerusalem must get out, and those who are near the city should not go in.

22.verse: These are the days of punishment to bring about all that is written in the Scriptures.

23.verse: How terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or have nursing babies! Great trouble will come upon this land, and God will be angry with these people.

24.verse: They will be killed by the sword and taken as prisoners to all nations. Jerusalem will be crushed by non-Jewish people until their time is over.

25.verse: Don’t Fear - “There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars. On earth, nations will be afraid and confused because of the roar and fury of the sea.

26.verse: People will be so afraid they will faint, wondering what is happening to the world, because the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

27.verse: Then people will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

28.verse: When these things begin to happen, look up and hold your heads high, because the time when God will free you is near!”

29.verse: Jesus’ Words Will Live Forever - Then Jesus told this story: “Look at the fig tree and all the other trees.

30.verse: When their leaves appear, you know that summer is near.

31.verse: In the same way, when you see these things happening, you will know that God’s kingdom is near.

32.verse: “I tell you the truth, all these things will happen while the people of this time are still living.

33.verse: Earth and sky will be destroyed, but the words I have spoken will never be destroyed.

34.verse: Be Ready All the Time - “Be careful not to spend your time feasting, drinking, or worrying about worldly things. If you do, that day might come on you suddenly,

35.verse: like a trap on all people on earth.

36.verse: So be ready all the time. Pray that you will be strong enough to escape all these things that will happen and that you will be able to stand before the Son of Man.”

37.verse: During the day, Jesus taught the people in the Temple, and at night he went out of the city and stayed on the Mount of Olives.

38.verse: Every morning all the people got up early to go to the Temple to listen to him.

1.verse: Judas Becomes an Enemy of Jesus - It was almost time for the Feast of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover Feast.

2.verse: The leading priests and teachers of the law were trying to find a way to kill Jesus, because they were afraid of the people.

3.verse: Satan entered Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ twelve apostles.

4.verse: Judas went to the leading priests and some of the soldiers who guarded the Temple and talked to them about a way to hand Jesus over to them.

5.verse: They were pleased and agreed to give Judas money.

6.verse: He agreed and watched for the best time to hand Jesus over to them when he was away from the crowd.

7.verse: Jesus Eats the Passover Meal - The Day of Unleavened Bread came when the Passover lambs had to be sacrificed.

8.verse: Jesus said to Peter and John, “Go and prepare the Passover meal for us to eat.”

9.verse: They asked, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”

10.verse: Jesus said to them, “After you go into the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters,

11.verse: and tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says: “Where is the guest room in which I may eat the Passover meal with my followers?”’

12.verse: Then he will show you a large, furnished room upstairs. Prepare the Passover meal there.”

13.verse: So Peter and John left and found everything as Jesus had said. And they prepared the Passover meal.

14.verse: The Lord’s Supper - When the time came, Jesus and the apostles were sitting at the table.

15.verse: He said to them, “I wanted very much to eat this Passover meal with you before I suffer.

16.verse: I will not eat another Passover meal until it is given its true meaning in the kingdom of God.”

17.verse: Then Jesus took a cup, gave thanks, and said, “Take this cup and share it among yourselves.

18.verse: I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until God’s kingdom comes.”

19.verse: Then Jesus took some bread, gave thanks, broke it, and gave it to the apostles, saying, “This is my body, which I am giving for you. Do this to remember me.”

20.verse: In the same way, after supper, Jesus took the cup and said, “This cup is the new agreement that God makes with his people. This new agreement begins with my blood which is poured out for you.

21.verse: Who Will Turn Against Jesus? - “But one of you will turn against me, and his hand is with mine on the table.

22.verse: What God has planned for the Son of Man will happen, but how terrible it will be for that one who turns against the Son of Man.”

23.verse: Then the apostles asked each other which one of them would do that.

24.verse: Be Like a Servant - The apostles also began to argue about which one of them was the most important.

25.verse: But Jesus said to them, “The kings of the non-Jewish people rule over them, and those who have authority over others like to be called ‘friends of the people.’

26.verse: But you must not be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the leader should be like the servant.

27.verse: Who is more important: the one sitting at the table or the one serving? You think the one at the table is more important, but I am like a servant among you.

28.verse: “You have stayed with me through my struggles.

29.verse: Just as my Father has given me a kingdom, I also give you a kingdom

30.verse: so you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom. And you will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.verse: Don’t Lose Your Faith! - “Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to test all of you as a farmer sifts his wheat.

32.verse: I have prayed that you will not lose your faith! Help your brothers be stronger when you come back to me.”

33.verse: But Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and even to die with you!”

34.verse: But Jesus said, “Peter, before the rooster crows this day, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”

35.verse: Be Ready for Trouble - Then Jesus said to the apostles, “When I sent you out without a purse, a bag, or sandals, did you need anything?” They said, “No.”

36.verse: He said to them, “But now if you have a purse or a bag, carry that with you. If you don’t have a sword, sell your coat and buy one.

37.verse: The Scripture says, ‘He was treated like a criminal,’ and I tell you this scripture must have its full meaning. It was written about me, and it is happening now.”

38.verse: His followers said, “Look, Lord, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”

39.verse: Jesus Prays Alone - Jesus left the city and went to the Mount of Olives, as he often did, and his followers went with him.

40.verse: When he reached the place, he said to them, “Pray for strength against temptation.”

41.verse: Then Jesus went about a stone’s throw away from them. He kneeled down and prayed,

42.verse: “Father, if you are willing, take away this cup of suffering. But do what you want, not what I want.”

43.verse: Then an angel from heaven appeared to him to strengthen him.

44.verse: Being full of pain, Jesus prayed even harder. His sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.

45.verse: When he finished praying, he went to his followers and found them asleep because of their sadness.

46.verse: Jesus said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray for strength against temptation.”

47.verse: Jesus Is Arrested - While Jesus was speaking, a crowd came up, and Judas, one of the twelve apostles, was leading them. He came close to Jesus so he could kiss him.

48.verse: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you using the kiss to give the Son of Man to his enemies?”

49.verse: When those who were standing around him saw what was happening, they said, “Lord, should we strike them with our swords?”

50.verse: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.

51.verse: Jesus said, “Stop! No more of this.” Then he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.

52.verse: Those who came to arrest Jesus were the leading priests, the soldiers who guarded the Temple, and the elders. Jesus said to them, “You came out here with swords and clubs as though I were a criminal.

53.verse: I was with you every day in the Temple, and you didn’t arrest me there. But this is your time—the time when darkness rules.”

54.verse: Peter Says He Doesn’t Know Jesus - They arrested Jesus, and led him away, and brought him into the house of the high priest. Peter followed far behind them.

55.verse: After the soldiers started a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat together, Peter sat with them.

56.verse: A servant girl saw Peter sitting there in the firelight, and looking closely at him, she said, “This man was also with him.”

57.verse: But Peter said this was not true; he said, “Woman, I don’t know him.”

58.verse: A short time later, another person saw Peter and said, “You are also one of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”

59.verse: About an hour later, another man insisted, “Certainly this man was with him, because he is from Galilee, too.”

60.verse: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” At once, while Peter was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

61.verse: Then the Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. And Peter remembered what the Lord had said: “Before the rooster crows this day, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”

62.verse: Then Peter went outside and cried painfully.

63.verse: The People Make Fun of Jesus - The men who were guarding Jesus began making fun of him and beating him.

64.verse: They blindfolded him and said, “Prove that you are a prophet, and tell us who hit you.”

65.verse: They said many cruel things to Jesus.

66.verse: Jesus Before the Leaders - When day came, the council of the elders of the people, both the leading priests and the teachers of the law, came together and led Jesus to their highest court.

67.verse: They said, “If you are the Christ, tell us.” Jesus said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe me.

68.verse: And if I ask you, you will not answer.

69.verse: But from now on, the Son of Man will sit at the right hand of the powerful God.”

70.verse: They all said, “Then are you the Son of God?” Jesus said to them, “You say that I am.”

71.verse: They said, “Why do we need witnesses now? We ourselves heard him say this.”

1.verse: Pilate Questions Jesus - Then the whole group stood up and led Jesus to Pilate.

2.verse: They began to accuse Jesus, saying, “We caught this man telling things that mislead our people. He says that we should not pay taxes to Caesar, and he calls himself the Christ, a king.”

3.verse: Pilate asked Jesus, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus answered, “Those are your words.”

4.verse: Pilate said to the leading priests and the people, “I find nothing against this man.”

5.verse: They were insisting, saying, “But Jesus makes trouble with the people, teaching all around Judea. He began in Galilee, and now he is here.”

6.verse: Pilate Sends Jesus to Herod - Pilate heard this and asked if Jesus was from Galilee.

7.verse: Since Jesus was under Herod’s authority, Pilate sent Jesus to Herod, who was in Jerusalem at that time.

8.verse: When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad, because he had heard about Jesus and had wanted to meet him for a long time. He was hoping to see Jesus work a miracle.

9.verse: Herod asked Jesus many questions, but Jesus said nothing.

10.verse: The leading priests and teachers of the law were standing there, strongly accusing Jesus.

11.verse: After Herod and his soldiers had made fun of Jesus, they dressed him in a kingly robe and sent him back to Pilate.

12.verse: In the past, Pilate and Herod had always been enemies, but on that day they became friends.

13.verse: Jesus Must Die - Pilate called the people together with the leading priests and the rulers.

14.verse: He said to them, “You brought this man to me, saying he makes trouble among the people. But I have questioned him before you all, and I have not found him guilty of what you say.

15.verse: Also, Herod found nothing wrong with him; he sent him back to us. Look, he has done nothing for which he should die.

16.verse: So, after I punish him, I will let him go free.”

17.verse: [ Every year at the Passover Feast, Pilate had to release one prisoner to the people.]

18.verse: But the people shouted together, “Take this man away! Let Barabbas go free!”

19.verse: (Barabbas was a man who was in prison for his part in a riot in the city and for murder.)

20.verse: Pilate wanted to let Jesus go free and told this to the crowd.

21.verse: But they shouted again, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

22.verse: A third time Pilate said to them, “Why? What wrong has he done? I can find no reason to kill him. So I will have him punished and set him free.”

23.verse: But they continued to shout, demanding that Jesus be crucified. Their yelling became so loud that

24.verse: Pilate decided to give them what they wanted.

25.verse: He set free the man who was in jail for rioting and murder, and he handed Jesus over to them to do with him as they wished.

26.verse: Jesus Is Crucified - As they led Jesus away, Simon, a man from Cyrene, was coming in from the fields. They forced him to carry Jesus’ cross and to walk behind him.

27.verse: A large crowd of people was following Jesus, including some women who were sad and crying for him.

28.verse: But Jesus turned and said to them, “Women of Jerusalem, don’t cry for me. Cry for yourselves and for your children.

29.verse: The time is coming when people will say, ‘Blessed are the women who cannot have children and who have no babies to nurse.’

30.verse: Then people will say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ And they will say to the hills, ‘Cover us!’

31.verse: If they act like this now when life is good, what will happen when bad times come?”

32.verse: There were also two criminals led out with Jesus to be put to death.

33.verse: When they came to a place called the Skull, the soldiers crucified Jesus and the criminals—one on his right and the other on his left.

34.verse: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, because they don’t know what they are doing.” The soldiers threw lots to decide who would get his clothes.

35.verse: The people stood there watching. And the leaders made fun of Jesus, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself if he is God’s Chosen One, the Christ.”

36.verse: The soldiers also made fun of him, coming to Jesus and offering him some vinegar.

37.verse: They said, “If you are the king of the Jews, save yourself!”

38.verse: At the top of the cross these words were written: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

39.verse: One of the criminals on a cross began to shout insults at Jesus: “Aren’t you the Christ? Then save yourself and us.”

40.verse: But the other criminal stopped him and said, “You should fear God! You are getting the same punishment he is.

41.verse: We are punished justly, getting what we deserve for what we did. But this man has done nothing wrong.”

42.verse: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.”

43.verse: Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today you will be with me in paradise.”

44.verse: Jesus Dies - It was about noon, and the whole land became dark until three o’clock in the afternoon,

45.verse: because the sun did not shine. The curtain in the Temple was torn in two.

46.verse: Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Father, I give you my life.” After Jesus said this, he died.

47.verse: When the army officer there saw what happened, he praised God, saying, “Surely this was a good man!”

48.verse: When all the people who had gathered there to watch saw what happened, they returned home, beating their chests because they were so sad.

49.verse: But those who were close friends of Jesus, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance and watched.

50.verse: Joseph Takes Jesus’ Body - There was a good and religious man named Joseph who was a member of the council.

51.verse: But he had not agreed to the other leaders’ plans and actions against Jesus. He was from the town of Arimathea and was waiting for the kingdom of God to come.

52.verse: Joseph went to Pilate to ask for the body of Jesus.

53.verse: He took the body down from the cross, wrapped it in cloth, and put it in a tomb that was cut out of a wall of rock. This tomb had never been used before.

54.verse: This was late on Preparation Day, and when the sun went down, the Sabbath day would begin.

55.verse: The women who had come from Galilee with Jesus followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how Jesus’ body was laid.

56.verse: Then the women left to prepare spices and perfumes. On the Sabbath day they rested, as the law of Moses commanded.

1.verse: Jesus Rises from the Dead - Very early on the first day of the week, at dawn, the women came to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared.

2.verse: They found the stone rolled away from the entrance of the tomb,

3.verse: but when they went in, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.verse: While they were wondering about this, two men in shining clothes suddenly stood beside them.

5.verse: The women were very afraid and bowed their heads to the ground. The men said to them, “Why are you looking for a living person in this place for the dead?

6.verse: He is not here; he has risen from the dead. Do you remember what he told you in Galilee?

7.verse: He said the Son of Man must be handed over to sinful people, be crucified, and rise from the dead on the third day.”

8.verse: Then the women remembered what Jesus had said.

9.verse: The women left the tomb and told all these things to the eleven apostles and the other followers.

10.verse: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and some other women who told the apostles everything that had happened at the tomb.

11.verse: But they did not believe the women, because it sounded like nonsense.

12.verse: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Bending down and looking in, he saw only the cloth that Jesus’ body had been wrapped in. Peter went away to his home, wondering about what had happened.

13.verse: Jesus on the Road to Emmaus - That same day two of Jesus’ followers were going to a town named Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.

14.verse: They were talking about everything that had happened.

15.verse: While they were talking and discussing, Jesus himself came near and began walking with them,

16.verse: but they were kept from recognizing him.

17.verse: Then he said, “What are these things you are talking about while you walk?” The two followers stopped, looking very sad.

18.verse: The one named Cleopas answered, “Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who does not know what just happened there?”

19.verse: Jesus said to them, “What are you talking about?” They said, “About Jesus of Nazareth. He was a prophet who said and did many powerful things before God and all the people.

20.verse: Our leaders and the leading priests handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him.

21.verse: But we were hoping that he would free Israel. Besides this, it is now the third day since this happened.

22.verse: And today some women among us amazed us. Early this morning they went to the tomb,

23.verse: but they did not find his body there. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels who said that Jesus was alive!

24.verse: So some of our group went to the tomb, too. They found it just as the women said, but they did not see Jesus.”

25.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “You are foolish and slow to believe everything the prophets said.

26.verse: They said that the Christ must suffer these things before he enters his glory.”

27.verse: Then starting with what Moses and all the prophets had said about him, Jesus began to explain everything that had been written about himself in the Scriptures.

28.verse: They came near the town of Emmaus, and Jesus acted as if he were going farther.

29.verse: But they begged him, “Stay with us, because it is late; it is almost night.” So he went in to stay with them.

30.verse: When Jesus was at the table with them, he took some bread, gave thanks, divided it, and gave it to them.

31.verse: And then, they were allowed to recognize Jesus. But when they saw who he was, he disappeared.

32.verse: They said to each other, “It felt like a fire burning in us when Jesus talked to us on the road and explained the Scriptures to us.”

33.verse: So the two followers got up at once and went back to Jerusalem. There they found the eleven apostles and others gathered.

34.verse: They were saying, “The Lord really has risen from the dead! He showed himself to Simon.”

35.verse: Then the two followers told what had happened on the road and how they recognized Jesus when he divided the bread.

36.verse: Jesus Appears to His Followers - While the two followers were telling this, Jesus himself stood right in the middle of them and said, “Peace be with you.”

37.verse: They were fearful and terrified and thought they were seeing a ghost.

38.verse: But Jesus said, “Why are you troubled? Why do you doubt what you see?

39.verse: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself! Touch me and see, because a ghost does not have a living body as you see I have.”

40.verse: After Jesus said this, he showed them his hands and feet.

41.verse: While they still could not believe it because they were amazed and happy, Jesus said to them, “Do you have any food here?”

42.verse: They gave him a piece of broiled fish.

43.verse: While the followers watched, Jesus took the fish and ate it.

44.verse: He said to them, “Remember when I was with you before? I said that everything written about me must happen—everything in the law of Moses, the books of the prophets, and the Psalms.”

45.verse: Then Jesus opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

46.verse: He said to them, “It is written that the Christ would suffer and rise from the dead on the third day

47.verse: and that a change of hearts and lives and forgiveness of sins would be preached in his name to all nations, starting at Jerusalem.

48.verse: You are witnesses of these things.

49.verse: I will send you what my Father has promised, but you must stay in Jerusalem until you have received that power from heaven.”

50.verse: Jesus Goes Back to Heaven - Jesus led his followers as far as Bethany, and he raised his hands and blessed them.

51.verse: While he was blessing them, he was separated from them and carried into heaven.

52.verse: They worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem very happy.

53.verse: They stayed in the Temple all the time, praising God.
